content: 1 The Visions of Isaiah son of Amoz, that he hath seen concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
content_old: 1 The Visions of Isaiah son of Amoz, that he hath seen concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

content: 2 Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth, For Jehovah hath spoken: Sons I have nourished and brought up, And they—they transgressed against Me.
content_old: 2 Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth, For Jehovah hath spoken: Sons I have nourished and brought up, And they—they transgressed against Me.

content: 3 An ox hath known its owner, And an ass the crib of its master, Israel hath not known, My people hath not understood.
content_old: 3 An ox hath known its owner, And an ass the crib of its master, Israel hath not known, My people hath not understood.

content: 4 Ah, sinning nation, a people heavy with iniquity, A seed of evil doers, sons—corrupters! They have forsaken Jehovah, They have despised the Holy One of Israel, They have gone away backward.
content_old: 4 Ah, sinning nation, a people heavy with iniquity, A seed of evil doers, sons—corrupters! They have forsaken Jehovah, They have despised the Holy One of Israel, They have gone away backward.

content: 5 Wherefore are ye stricken any more? Ye do add apostasy! Every head is become diseased, and every heart is sick.
content_old: 5 Wherefore are ye stricken any more? Ye do add apostasy! Every head is become diseased, and every heart is sick.

content: 6 From the sole of the foot—unto the head, There is no soundness in it, Wound, and bruise, and fresh smiting! They have not been closed nor bound, Nor have they softened with ointment.
content_old: 6 From the sole of the foot—unto the head, There is no soundness in it, Wound, and bruise, and fresh smiting! They have not been closed nor bound, Nor have they softened with ointment.

content: 7 Your land is a desolation, your cities burnt with fire, Your ground, before you strangers are consuming it, And a desolation as overthrown by strangers!
content_old: 7 Your land is a desolation, your cities burnt with fire, Your ground, before you strangers are consuming it, And a desolation as overthrown by strangers!

content: 8 And left hath been the daughter of Zion, As a booth in a vineyard, As a lodge in a place of cucumbers—as a city besieged.
content_old: 8 And left hath been the daughter of Zion, As a booth in a vineyard, As a lodge in a place of cucumbers—as a city besieged.

content: 9 Unless Jehovah of Hosts had left to us a remnant, Shortly—as Sodom we had been, To Gomorrah we had been like!
content_old: 9 Unless Jehovah of Hosts had left to us a remnant, Shortly—as Sodom we had been, To Gomorrah we had been like!

content: 10 Hear the word of Jehovah, ye rulers of Sodom, Give ear to the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah,
content_old: 10 Hear the word of Jehovah, ye rulers of Sodom, Give ear to the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah,

content: 11 ‘Why to Me the abundance of your sacrifices? saith Jehovah, I have been satiated with burnt-offerings of rams, And fat of fatlings; And blood of bullocks, and lambs, And he-goats I have not desired.
content_old: 11 ‘Why to Me the abundance of your sacrifices? saith Jehovah, I have been satiated with burnt-offerings of rams, And fat of fatlings; And blood of bullocks, and lambs, And he-goats I have not desired.

content: 12 When ye come in to appear before Me, Who hath required this of your hand, To trample My courts?
content_old: 12 When ye come in to appear before Me, Who hath required this of your hand, To trample My courts?

content: 13 Add not to bring in a vain present, Incense—an abomination it is to Me, New moon, and sabbath, calling of convocation! Rendure not iniquity—and a restraint!
content_old: 13 Add not to bring in a vain present, Incense—an abomination it is to Me, New moon, and sabbath, calling of convocation! Rendure not iniquity—and a restraint!

content: 14 Your new moons and your set seasons hath My soul hated, They have been upon me for a burden, I have been weary of bearing.
content_old: 14 Your new moons and your set seasons hath My soul hated, They have been upon me for a burden, I have been weary of bearing.

content: 15 And in your spreading forth your hands, I hide mine eyes from you, Also when ye increase prayer, I do not hear, Your hands of blood have been full.
content_old: 15 And in your spreading forth your hands, I hide mine eyes from you, Also when ye increase prayer, I do not hear, Your hands of blood have been full.

content: 16 Wash ye, make ye pure, Turn aside the evil of your doings, from before Mine eyes, Cease to do evil, learn to do good.
content_old: 16 Wash ye, make ye pure, Turn aside the evil of your doings, from before Mine eyes, Cease to do evil, learn to do good.

content: 17 Seek judgment, make happy the oppressed, Judge the fatherless, strive for the widow.
content_old: 17 Seek judgment, make happy the oppressed, Judge the fatherless, strive for the widow.

content: 18 Come, I pray you, and we reason, saith Jehovah, If your sins are as scarlet, as snow they shall be white, If they are red as crimson, as wool they shall be!
content_old: 18 Come, I pray you, and we reason, saith Jehovah, If your sins are as scarlet, as snow they shall be white, If they are red as crimson, as wool they shall be!

content: 19 If ye are willing, and have hearkened, The good of the land ye consume,
content_old: 19 If ye are willing, and have hearkened, The good of the land ye consume,

content: 20 And if ye refuse, and have rebelled, By the sword ye are consumed, For the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken.
content_old: 20 And if ye refuse, and have rebelled, By the sword ye are consumed, For the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken.

content: 21 How hath a faithful city become a harlot? I have filled it with judgment, Righteousness lodgeth in it—now murderers.
content_old: 21 How hath a faithful city become a harlot? I have filled it with judgment, Righteousness lodgeth in it—now murderers.

content: 22 Thy silver hath become dross, Thy drink polluted with water.
content_old: 22 Thy silver hath become dross, Thy drink polluted with water.

content: 23 Thy princes are apostates, and companions of thieves, Every one loving a bribe, and pursuing rewards, The fatherless they judge not, And the plea of the widow cometh not to them.
content_old: 23 Thy princes are apostates, and companions of thieves, Every one loving a bribe, and pursuing rewards, The fatherless they judge not, And the plea of the widow cometh not to them.

content: 24 Therefore—the affirmation of the Lord—Jehovah of Hosts, the Mighty One of Israel: Ah, I am eased of Mine adversaries, And I am avenged of Mine enemies,
content_old: 24 Therefore—the affirmation of the Lord—Jehovah of Hosts, the Mighty One of Israel: Ah, I am eased of Mine adversaries, And I am avenged of Mine enemies,

content: 25 And I turn back My hand upon thee, And I refine as purity thy dross, And I turn aside all thy tin,
content_old: 25 And I turn back My hand upon thee, And I refine as purity thy dross, And I turn aside all thy tin,

content: 26 And I give back thy judges as at the first, And thy counsellors as in the beginning, After this thou art called, ‘A city of righteousness—a faithful city.’
content_old: 26 And I give back thy judges as at the first, And thy counsellors as in the beginning, After this thou art called, ‘A city of righteousness—a faithful city.’

content: 27 Zion in judgment is redeemed, And her captivity in righteousness.
content_old: 27 Zion in judgment is redeemed, And her captivity in righteousness.

content: 28 And the destruction of transgressors and sinners is together, And those forsaking Jehovah are consumed.
content_old: 28 And the destruction of transgressors and sinners is together, And those forsaking Jehovah are consumed.

content: 29 For men are ashamed because of the oaks That ye have desired, And ye are confounded because of the gardens That ye have chosen.
content_old: 29 For men are ashamed because of the oaks That ye have desired, And ye are confounded because of the gardens That ye have chosen.

content: 30 For ye are as an oak whose leaf is fading, And as a garden that hath no water.
content_old: 30 For ye are as an oak whose leaf is fading, And as a garden that hath no water.

content: 1 The thing that Isaiah son of Amoz hath seen concerning Judah and Jerusalem:
content_old: 1 The thing that Isaiah son of Amoz hath seen concerning Judah and Jerusalem:

content: 2 And it hath come to pass, In the latter end of the days, Established is the mount of Jehovah’s house, Above the top of the mounts, And it hath been lifted up above the heights, And flowed unto it have all the nations.
content_old: 2 And it hath come to pass, In the latter end of the days, Established is the mount of Jehovah’s house, Above the top of the mounts, And it hath been lifted up above the heights, And flowed unto it have all the nations.

content: 3 And gone have many peoples and said, ‘Come, and we go up unto the mount of Jehovah, Unto the house of the God of Jacob, And He doth teach us of His ways, And we walk in His paths, For from Zion goeth forth a law, And a word of Jehovah from Jerusalem.
content_old: 3 And gone have many peoples and said, ‘Come, and we go up unto the mount of Jehovah, Unto the house of the God of Jacob, And He doth teach us of His ways, And we walk in His paths, For from Zion goeth forth a law, And a word of Jehovah from Jerusalem.

content: 4 And He hath judged between the nations, And hath given a decision to many peoples, And they have beat their swords to ploughshares, And their spears to pruning-hooks, Nation doth not lift up sword unto nation, Nor do they learn any more—war.
content_old: 4 And He hath judged between the nations, And hath given a decision to many peoples, And they have beat their swords to ploughshares, And their spears to pruning-hooks, Nation doth not lift up sword unto nation, Nor do they learn any more—war.

content: 5 O house of Jacob, come, And we walk in the light of Jehovah.’
content_old: 5 O house of Jacob, come, And we walk in the light of Jehovah.’

content: 6 For Thou hast left Thy people, the house of Jacob. For they have been filled from the east, And are sorcerers like the Philistines, And with the children of strangers strike hands.
content_old: 6 For Thou hast left Thy people, the house of Jacob. For they have been filled from the east, And are sorcerers like the Philistines, And with the children of strangers strike hands.

content: 7 And its land is full of silver and gold, And there is no end to its treasures, And its land is full of horses, And there is no end to its chariots,
content_old: 7 And its land is full of silver and gold, And there is no end to its treasures, And its land is full of horses, And there is no end to its chariots,

content: 8 And its land is full of idols, To the work of its hands it boweth itself, To that which its fingers have made,
content_old: 8 And its land is full of idols, To the work of its hands it boweth itself, To that which its fingers have made,

content: 9 And the low boweth down, and the high is humbled, And Thou acceptest them not.
content_old: 9 And the low boweth down, and the high is humbled, And Thou acceptest them not.

content: 10 Enter into a rock, and be hidden in dust, Because of the fear of Jehovah, And because of the honour of His excellency.
content_old: 10 Enter into a rock, and be hidden in dust, Because of the fear of Jehovah, And because of the honour of His excellency.

content: 11 The haughty eyes of man have been humbled, And bowed down hath been the loftiness of men, And set on high hath Jehovah alone been in that day.
content_old: 11 The haughty eyes of man have been humbled, And bowed down hath been the loftiness of men, And set on high hath Jehovah alone been in that day.

content: 12 For a day is to Jehovah of Hosts, For every proud and high one, And for every lifted up and low one,
content_old: 12 For a day is to Jehovah of Hosts, For every proud and high one, And for every lifted up and low one,

content: 13 And for all cedars of Lebanon, The high and the exalted ones, And for all oaks of Bashan,
content_old: 13 And for all cedars of Lebanon, The high and the exalted ones, And for all oaks of Bashan,

content: 14 And for all the high mountains, And for all the exalted heights,
content_old: 14 And for all the high mountains, And for all the exalted heights,

content: 15 And for every high tower, And for every fenced wall,
content_old: 15 And for every high tower, And for every fenced wall,

content: 16 And for all ships of Tarshish, And for all desirable pictures.
content_old: 16 And for all ships of Tarshish, And for all desirable pictures.

content: 17 And bowed down hath been the haughtiness of man, And humbled the loftiness of men, And set on high hath Jehovah alone been in that day.
content_old: 17 And bowed down hath been the haughtiness of man, And humbled the loftiness of men, And set on high hath Jehovah alone been in that day.

content: 18 And the idols—they completely pass away.
content_old: 18 And the idols—they completely pass away.

content: 19 And men have entered into caverns of rocks, And into caves of dust, Because of the fear of Jehovah, And because of the honour of His excellency, In His rising to terrify the earth.
content_old: 19 And men have entered into caverns of rocks, And into caves of dust, Because of the fear of Jehovah, And because of the honour of His excellency, In His rising to terrify the earth.

content: 20 In that day doth man cast his idols of silver, And his idols of gold, That they have made for him to worship, To moles, and to bats,
content_old: 20 In that day doth man cast his idols of silver, And his idols of gold, That they have made for him to worship, To moles, and to bats,

content: 21 To enter into cavities of the rocks, And into clefts of the high places, Because of the fear of Jehovah, And because of the honour of His excellency, In His rising to terrify the earth.
content_old: 21 To enter into cavities of the rocks, And into clefts of the high places, Because of the fear of Jehovah, And because of the honour of His excellency, In His rising to terrify the earth.

content: 1 For, lo, the Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, Is turning aside from Jerusalem, And from Judah, stay and staff, Every stay of bread, and every stay of water.
content_old: 1 For, lo, the Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, Is turning aside from Jerusalem, And from Judah, stay and staff, Every stay of bread, and every stay of water.

content: 2 Hero and man of war, judge and prophet, And diviner and elder,
content_old: 2 Hero and man of war, judge and prophet, And diviner and elder,

content: 3 Head of fifty, and accepted of faces, And counsellor, and the wise of artificers, And the intelligent of charmers.
content_old: 3 Head of fifty, and accepted of faces, And counsellor, and the wise of artificers, And the intelligent of charmers.

content: 4 And I have made youths their heads, And sucklings rule over them.
content_old: 4 And I have made youths their heads, And sucklings rule over them.

content: 5 And the people hath exacted—man upon man, Even a man on his neighbour, Enlarge themselves do the youths against the aged, And the lightly esteemed against the honoured.
content_old: 5 And the people hath exacted—man upon man, Even a man on his neighbour, Enlarge themselves do the youths against the aged, And the lightly esteemed against the honoured.

content: 6 When one layeth hold on his brother, Of the house of his father, by the garment, ‘Come, a ruler thou art to us, And this ruin is under thy hand.’
content_old: 6 When one layeth hold on his brother, Of the house of his father, by the garment, ‘Come, a ruler thou art to us, And this ruin is under thy hand.’

content: 7 He lifteth up, in that day, saying: ‘I am not a binder up, And in my house is neither bread nor garment, Ye do not make me a ruler of the people.’
content_old: 7 He lifteth up, in that day, saying: ‘I am not a binder up, And in my house is neither bread nor garment, Ye do not make me a ruler of the people.’

content: 8 For stumbled hath Jerusalem, and Judah hath fallen, For their tongue and their doings are against Jehovah, To provoke the eyes of His glory.
content_old: 8 For stumbled hath Jerusalem, and Judah hath fallen, For their tongue and their doings are against Jehovah, To provoke the eyes of His glory.

content: 9 The appearance of their faces witnessed against them, And their sin, as Sodom, they declared, They have not hidden! Woe to their soul, For they have done to themselves evil.
content_old: 9 The appearance of their faces witnessed against them, And their sin, as Sodom, they declared, They have not hidden! Woe to their soul, For they have done to themselves evil.

content: 10 Say ye to the righteous, that it is good, Because the fruit of their doings they eat.
content_old: 10 Say ye to the righteous, that it is good, Because the fruit of their doings they eat.

content: 11 Woe to the wicked—evil, Because the deed of his hand is done to him.
content_old: 11 Woe to the wicked—evil, Because the deed of his hand is done to him.

content: 12 My people—its exactors are sucklings, And women have ruled over it. My people—thy eulogists are causing to err, And the way of thy paths swallowed up.
content_old: 12 My people—its exactors are sucklings, And women have ruled over it. My people—thy eulogists are causing to err, And the way of thy paths swallowed up.

content: 13 Jehovah hath stood up to plead, And He is standing to judge the peoples.
content_old: 13 Jehovah hath stood up to plead, And He is standing to judge the peoples.

content: 14 Jehovah into judgment doth enter With elders of His people, and its heads: ‘And ye, ye have consumed the vineyard, Plunder of the poor is in your houses.
content_old: 14 Jehovah into judgment doth enter With elders of His people, and its heads: ‘And ye, ye have consumed the vineyard, Plunder of the poor is in your houses.

content: 15 What—to you? ye bruise My people, And the faces of the poor ye grind.’ An affirmation of the Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, And Jehovah saith:
content_old: 15 What—to you? ye bruise My people, And the faces of the poor ye grind.’ An affirmation of the Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, And Jehovah saith:

content: 16 ‘Because that daughters of Zion have been haughty, And they walk stretching out the neck, And deceiving with the eyes, Walking and mincing they go, And with their feet they make a tinkling,
content_old: 16 ‘Because that daughters of Zion have been haughty, And they walk stretching out the neck, And deceiving with the eyes, Walking and mincing they go, And with their feet they make a tinkling,

content: 17 The Lord also hath scabbed The crown of the head of daughters of Zion, And Jehovah their simplicity exposeth.
content_old: 17 The Lord also hath scabbed The crown of the head of daughters of Zion, And Jehovah their simplicity exposeth.

content: 18 In that day doth the Lord turn aside The beauty of the tinkling ornaments, And of the embroidered works, And of the round tires like moons,
content_old: 18 In that day doth the Lord turn aside The beauty of the tinkling ornaments, And of the embroidered works, And of the round tires like moons,

content: 19 Of the drops, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,
content_old: 19 Of the drops, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,

content: 20 Of the bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, And of the bands, And of the perfume boxes, and the amulets,
content_old: 20 Of the bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, And of the bands, And of the perfume boxes, and the amulets,

content: 21 Of the seals, and of the nose-rings,
content_old: 21 Of the seals, and of the nose-rings,

content: 22 Of the costly apparel, and of the mantles, And of the coverings, and of the purses,
content_old: 22 Of the costly apparel, and of the mantles, And of the coverings, and of the purses,

content: 23 Of the mirrors, and of the linen garments, And of the hoods, and of the vails,
content_old: 23 Of the mirrors, and of the linen garments, And of the hoods, and of the vails,

content: 24 And it hath been, instead of spice is muck, And instead of a girdle, a rope, And instead of curled work, baldness, And instead of a stomacher a girdle of sackcloth.
content_old: 24 And it hath been, instead of spice is muck, And instead of a girdle, a rope, And instead of curled work, baldness, And instead of a stomacher a girdle of sackcloth.

content: 25 For instead of glory, thy men by sword do fall, And thy might in battle.
content_old: 25 For instead of glory, thy men by sword do fall, And thy might in battle.

content: 1 And taken hold have seven women on one man, In that day, saying, ‘Our own bread we do eat, And our own raiment we put on, Only, let thy name be called over us, Remove thou our reproach.’
content_old: 1 And taken hold have seven women on one man, In that day, saying, ‘Our own bread we do eat, And our own raiment we put on, Only, let thy name be called over us, Remove thou our reproach.’

content: 2 In that day is the Shoot of Jehovah for desire and for honour, And the fruit of the earth For excellence and for beauty to the escaped of Israel.
content_old: 2 In that day is the Shoot of Jehovah for desire and for honour, And the fruit of the earth For excellence and for beauty to the escaped of Israel.

content: 3 And it hath been, he who is left in Zion, And he who is remaining in Jerusalem, ‘Holy’ is said of him, Of every one who is written for life in Jerusalem.
content_old: 3 And it hath been, he who is left in Zion, And he who is remaining in Jerusalem, ‘Holy’ is said of him, Of every one who is written for life in Jerusalem.

content: 4 If the Lord hath washed away The filth of daughters of Zion, And the blood of Jerusalem purgeth from her midst, By the spirit of judgment, and by the spirit of burning.
content_old: 4 If the Lord hath washed away The filth of daughters of Zion, And the blood of Jerusalem purgeth from her midst, By the spirit of judgment, and by the spirit of burning.

content: 5 Then hath Jehovah prepared Over every fixed place of Mount Zion, And over her convocations, A cloud by day, and smoke, And the shining of a flaming fire by night, That, over all honour a safe-guard,
content_old: 5 Then hath Jehovah prepared Over every fixed place of Mount Zion, And over her convocations, A cloud by day, and smoke, And the shining of a flaming fire by night, That, over all honour a safe-guard,

content: 1 Let me sing, I pray you, for my beloved, A song of my beloved as to his vineyard: My beloved hath a vineyard in a fruitful hill,
content_old: 1 Let me sing, I pray you, for my beloved, A song of my beloved as to his vineyard: My beloved hath a vineyard in a fruitful hill,

content: 2 And he fenceth it, and casteth out its stones, And planteth it with a choice vine, And buildeth a tower in its midst, And also a wine press hath hewn out in it, And he waiteth for the yielding of grapes, And it yieldeth bad ones!
content_old: 2 And he fenceth it, and casteth out its stones, And planteth it with a choice vine, And buildeth a tower in its midst, And also a wine press hath hewn out in it, And he waiteth for the yielding of grapes, And it yieldeth bad ones!

content: 3 And now, O inhabitant of Jerusalem, and man of Judah, Judge, I pray you, between me and my vineyard.
content_old: 3 And now, O inhabitant of Jerusalem, and man of Judah, Judge, I pray you, between me and my vineyard.

content: 4 What—to do still to my vineyard, That I have not done in it! Wherefore, I waited to the yielding of grapes, And it yieldeth bad ones!
content_old: 4 What—to do still to my vineyard, That I have not done in it! Wherefore, I waited to the yielding of grapes, And it yieldeth bad ones!

content: 5 And now, pray, let me cause you to know, That which I am doing to my vineyard, To turn aside its hedge, And it hath been for consumption, To break down its wall, And it hath been for a treading-place.
content_old: 5 And now, pray, let me cause you to know, That which I am doing to my vineyard, To turn aside its hedge, And it hath been for consumption, To break down its wall, And it hath been for a treading-place.

content: 6 And I make it a waste, It is not pruned, nor arranged, And gone up have brier and thorn, And on the thick clouds I lay a charge, From raining upon it rain.
content_old: 6 And I make it a waste, It is not pruned, nor arranged, And gone up have brier and thorn, And on the thick clouds I lay a charge, From raining upon it rain.

content: 7 Because the vineyard of Jehovah of Hosts Is the house of Israel, And the man of Judah His pleasant plant, And He waiteth for judgment, and lo, oppression, For righteousness, and lo, a cry.
content_old: 7 Because the vineyard of Jehovah of Hosts Is the house of Israel, And the man of Judah His pleasant plant, And He waiteth for judgment, and lo, oppression, For righteousness, and lo, a cry.

content: 8 Woe to those joining house to house, Field to field they bring near, till there is no place, And ye have been settled by yourselves In the midst of the land!
content_old: 8 Woe to those joining house to house, Field to field they bring near, till there is no place, And ye have been settled by yourselves In the midst of the land!

content: 9 By the weapons of Jehovah of Hosts Do not many houses a desolation become? Great and good without inhabitant!
content_old: 9 By the weapons of Jehovah of Hosts Do not many houses a desolation become? Great and good without inhabitant!

content: 10 For ten acres of vineyard do yield one bath, And an homer of seed yieldeth an ephah.
content_old: 10 For ten acres of vineyard do yield one bath, And an homer of seed yieldeth an ephah.

content: 11 Woe to those rising early in the morning, Strong drink they pursue! Tarrying in twilight, wine inflameth them!
content_old: 11 Woe to those rising early in the morning, Strong drink they pursue! Tarrying in twilight, wine inflameth them!

content: 12 And harp, and psaltery, tabret, and pipe, And wine, have been their banquets, And the work of Jehovah they behold not, Yea, the work of His hands they have not seen.
content_old: 12 And harp, and psaltery, tabret, and pipe, And wine, have been their banquets, And the work of Jehovah they behold not, Yea, the work of His hands they have not seen.

content: 13 Therefore my people removed without knowledge, And its honourable ones are famished, And its multitude dried up of thirst.
content_old: 13 Therefore my people removed without knowledge, And its honourable ones are famished, And its multitude dried up of thirst.

content: 14 Therefore hath Sheol enlarged herself, And hath opened her mouth without limit. And gone down hath its honour, and its multitude, And its noise, and its exulting one—into her.
content_old: 14 Therefore hath Sheol enlarged herself, And hath opened her mouth without limit. And gone down hath its honour, and its multitude, And its noise, and its exulting one—into her.

content: 15 And bowed down is the low, and humbled the high, And the eyes of the haughty become low,
content_old: 15 And bowed down is the low, and humbled the high, And the eyes of the haughty become low,

content: 16 And Jehovah of Hosts is high in judgment, And the Holy God sanctified in righteousness,
content_old: 16 And Jehovah of Hosts is high in judgment, And the Holy God sanctified in righteousness,

content: 17 And fed have lambs according to their leading, And waste places of the fat ones Do sojourners consume.
content_old: 17 And fed have lambs according to their leading, And waste places of the fat ones Do sojourners consume.

content: 18 Woe to those drawing out iniquity with cords of vanity, And as with thick ropes of the cart—sin.
content_old: 18 Woe to those drawing out iniquity with cords of vanity, And as with thick ropes of the cart—sin.

content: 19 Who are saying, ‘Let Him hurry, Let Him hasten His work, that we may see, And let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel Draw near and come, and we know.’
content_old: 19 Who are saying, ‘Let Him hurry, Let Him hasten His work, that we may see, And let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel Draw near and come, and we know.’

content: 20 Woe to those saying to evil ‘good,’ And to good ‘evil,’ Putting darkness for light, and light for darkness, Putting bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter.
content_old: 20 Woe to those saying to evil ‘good,’ And to good ‘evil,’ Putting darkness for light, and light for darkness, Putting bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter.

content: 21 Woe to the wise in their own eyes, And—before their own faces—intelligent!
content_old: 21 Woe to the wise in their own eyes, And—before their own faces—intelligent!

content: 22 Woe to the mighty to drink wine, And men of strength to mingle strong drink.
content_old: 22 Woe to the mighty to drink wine, And men of strength to mingle strong drink.

content: 23 Declaring righteous the wicked for a bribe, And the righteousness of the righteous They turn aside from him.
content_old: 23 Declaring righteous the wicked for a bribe, And the righteousness of the righteous They turn aside from him.

content: 24 Therefore, as a tongue of fire devoureth stubble, And flaming hay falleth, Their root is as muck, And their flower as dust goeth up. Because they have rejected the law of Jehovah of Hosts, And the saying of the Holy One of Israel despised.
content_old: 24 Therefore, as a tongue of fire devoureth stubble, And flaming hay falleth, Their root is as muck, And their flower as dust goeth up. Because they have rejected the law of Jehovah of Hosts, And the saying of the Holy One of Israel despised.

content: 25 Therefore hath the anger of Jehovah burned among His people, And He stretcheth out His hand against it, And smiteth it, and the mountains tremble, And their carcase is as filth in the midst of the out-places. With all this His anger did not turn back, And still His hand is stretched out!

content: 26 And He lifted up an ensign to nations afar off, And hissed to it from the end of the earth, And lo, with haste, swift it cometh.
content_old: 26 And He lifted up an ensign to nations afar off, And hissed to it from the end of the earth, And lo, with haste, swift it cometh.

content: 27 There is none weary, nor stumbling in it, It doth not slumber, nor sleep, Nor opened hath been the girdle of its loins, Nor drawn away the latchet of its sandals.
content_old: 27 There is none weary, nor stumbling in it, It doth not slumber, nor sleep, Nor opened hath been the girdle of its loins, Nor drawn away the latchet of its sandals.

content: 28 Whose arrows are sharp, and all its bows bent, Hoofs of its horses as flint have been reckoned, And its wheels as a hurricane!
content_old: 28 Whose arrows are sharp, and all its bows bent, Hoofs of its horses as flint have been reckoned, And its wheels as a hurricane!

content: 29 Its roaring is like a lioness, It roareth like young lions, And it howleth, and seizeth prey, And carrieth away safely, and there is none delivering.

content: 1 In the year of the death of king Uzziah—I see the Lord, sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and His train is filling the temple.
content_old: 1 In the year of the death of king Uzziah—I see the Lord, sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and His train is filling the temple.

content: 2 Seraphs are standing above it: six wings hath each one; with two each covereth its face, and with two each covereth its feet, and with two each flieth.
content_old: 2 Seraphs are standing above it: six wings hath each one; with two each covereth its face, and with two each covereth its feet, and with two each flieth.

content: 3 And this one hath called unto that, and hath said: ‘Holy, Holy, Holy, is Jehovah of Hosts, The fulness of all the earth is His glory.’
content_old: 3 And this one hath called unto that, and hath said: ‘Holy, Holy, Holy, is Jehovah of Hosts, The fulness of all the earth is His glory.’

content: 4 And the posts of the thresholds are moved by the voice of him who is calling, and the house is full of smoke.
content_old: 4 And the posts of the thresholds are moved by the voice of him who is calling, and the house is full of smoke.

content: 5 And I say, ‘Woe to me, for I have been silent, For a man—unclean of lips am I, And in midst of a people unclean of lips I am dwelling, Because the King, Jehovah of Hosts, have my eyes seen.’
content_old: 5 And I say, ‘Woe to me, for I have been silent, For a man—unclean of lips am I, And in midst of a people unclean of lips I am dwelling, Because the King, Jehovah of Hosts, have my eyes seen.’

content: 6 And flee unto me doth one of the seraphs, and in his hand a burning coal, (with tongs he hath taken it from off the altar,)
content_old: 6 And flee unto me doth one of the seraphs, and in his hand a burning coal, (with tongs he hath taken it from off the altar,)

content: 7 and he striketh against my mouth, and saith: ‘Lo, this hath stricken against thy lips, And turned aside is thine iniquity, And thy sin is covered.’
content_old: 7 and he striketh against my mouth, and saith: ‘Lo, this hath stricken against thy lips, And turned aside is thine iniquity, And thy sin is covered.’

content: 8 And I hear the voice of the Lord, saying: ‘Whom do I send? and who doth go for Us?’ And I say, ‘Here am I, send me.’
content_old: 8 And I hear the voice of the Lord, saying: ‘Whom do I send? and who doth go for Us?’ And I say, ‘Here am I, send me.’

content: 9 And He saith, ‘Go, and thou hast said to this people, Hear ye—to hear, and ye do not understand, And see ye—to see, and ye do not know.
content_old: 9 And He saith, ‘Go, and thou hast said to this people, Hear ye—to hear, and ye do not understand, And see ye—to see, and ye do not know.

content: 10 Declare fat the heart of this people, And its ears declare heavy, And its eyes declare dazzled, Lest it see with its eyes, And with its ears hear, and its heart consider, And it hath turned back, and hath health.’
content_old: 10 Declare fat the heart of this people, And its ears declare heavy, And its eyes declare dazzled, Lest it see with its eyes, And with its ears hear, and its heart consider, And it hath turned back, and hath health.’

content: 11 And I say, ‘Till when, O Lord?’ And He saith, ‘Surely till cities have been wasted without inhabitant, And houses without man, And the ground be wasted—a desolation,
content_old: 11 And I say, ‘Till when, O Lord?’ And He saith, ‘Surely till cities have been wasted without inhabitant, And houses without man, And the ground be wasted—a desolation,

content: 12 And Jehovah hath put man far off, And great is the forsaken part in the heart of the land.
content_old: 12 And Jehovah hath put man far off, And great is the forsaken part in the heart of the land.

content: 1 And it cometh to pass in the days of Ahaz, son of Jotham, son of Uzziah, king of Judah, gone up hath Rezin king of Aram, and Pekah, son of Remaliah, king of Israel, to Jerusalem, to battle against it, and he is not able to fight against it.
content_old: 1 And it cometh to pass in the days of Ahaz, son of Jotham, son of Uzziah, king of Judah, gone up hath Rezin king of Aram, and Pekah, son of Remaliah, king of Israel, to Jerusalem, to battle against it, and he is not able to fight against it.

content: 2 And it is declared to the house of David, saying, ‘Aram hath been led towards Ephraim,’ And his heart and the heart of his people is moved, like the moving of trees of a forest by the presence of wind.
content_old: 2 And it is declared to the house of David, saying, ‘Aram hath been led towards Ephraim,’ And his heart and the heart of his people is moved, like the moving of trees of a forest by the presence of wind.

content: 3 And Jehovah saith unto Isaiah, ‘Go forth, I pray thee, to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shear-Jashub thy son, unto the end of the conduit of the upper pool, unto the highway of the fuller’s field,
content_old: 3 And Jehovah saith unto Isaiah, ‘Go forth, I pray thee, to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shear-Jashub thy son, unto the end of the conduit of the upper pool, unto the highway of the fuller’s field,

content: 4 and thou hast said unto him: ‘Take heed, and be quiet, fear not, And let not thy heart be timid, Because of these two tails of smoking brands, For the fierceness of the anger of Rezin and Aram, And the son of Remaliah.
content_old: 4 and thou hast said unto him: ‘Take heed, and be quiet, fear not, And let not thy heart be timid, Because of these two tails of smoking brands, For the fierceness of the anger of Rezin and Aram, And the son of Remaliah.

content: 5 Because that Aram counselled against thee evil, Ephraim and the son of Remaliah, saying:
content_old: 5 Because that Aram counselled against thee evil, Ephraim and the son of Remaliah, saying:

content: 6 We go up into Judah, and we vex it, And we rend it unto ourselves, And we cause a king to reign in its midst—The son of Tabeal.
content_old: 6 We go up into Judah, and we vex it, And we rend it unto ourselves, And we cause a king to reign in its midst—The son of Tabeal.

content: 7 Thus said the Lord Jehovah: It doth not stand, nor shall it be!
content_old: 7 Thus said the Lord Jehovah: It doth not stand, nor shall it be!

content: 8 For the head of Aram is Damascus, And the head of Damascus is Rezin, And within sixty and five years Is Ephraim broken from being a people.
content_old: 8 For the head of Aram is Damascus, And the head of Damascus is Rezin, And within sixty and five years Is Ephraim broken from being a people.

content: 9 And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, And the head of Samaria is the son of Remaliah. If ye do not give credence, Surely ye are not stedfast.’
content_old: 9 And the head of Ephraim is Samaria, And the head of Samaria is the son of Remaliah. If ye do not give credence, Surely ye are not stedfast.’

content: 10 And Jehovah addeth to speak unto Ahaz, saying:
content_old: 10 And Jehovah addeth to speak unto Ahaz, saying:

content: 11 ‘Ask for thee a sign from Jehovah thy God, Make deep the request, or make it high upwards.’
content_old: 11 ‘Ask for thee a sign from Jehovah thy God, Make deep the request, or make it high upwards.’

content: 12 And Ahaz saith, ‘I do not ask nor try Jehovah.’
content_old: 12 And Ahaz saith, ‘I do not ask nor try Jehovah.’

content: 13 And he saith, ‘Hear, I pray you, O house of David, Is it a little thing for you to weary men, That ye weary also my God?
content_old: 13 And he saith, ‘Hear, I pray you, O house of David, Is it a little thing for you to weary men, That ye weary also my God?

content: 14 Therefore the Lord Himself giveth to you a sign, Lo, the Virgin is conceiving, And is bringing forth a son, And hath called his name Immanuel,
content_old: 14 Therefore the Lord Himself giveth to you a sign, Lo, the Virgin is conceiving, And is bringing forth a son, And hath called his name Immanuel,

content: 15 Butter and honey he doth eat, When he knoweth to refuse evil, and to fix on good.
content_old: 15 Butter and honey he doth eat, When he knoweth to refuse evil, and to fix on good.

content: 16 For before the youth doth know To refuse evil, and to fix on good, Forsaken is the land thou art vexed with, because of her two kings.
content_old: 16 For before the youth doth know To refuse evil, and to fix on good, Forsaken is the land thou art vexed with, because of her two kings.

content: 17 Jehovah bringeth on thee, and on thy people, And on the house of thy father, Days that have not come, Even from the day of the turning aside of Ephraim from Judah, By the king of Asshur.
content_old: 17 Jehovah bringeth on thee, and on thy people, And on the house of thy father, Days that have not come, Even from the day of the turning aside of Ephraim from Judah, By the king of Asshur.

content: 18 And it hath come to pass, in that day, Jehovah doth hiss for a fly that is in the extremity of the brooks of Egypt, And for a bee that is in the land of Asshur.
content_old: 18 And it hath come to pass, in that day, Jehovah doth hiss for a fly that is in the extremity of the brooks of Egypt, And for a bee that is in the land of Asshur.

content: 19 And they have come, and rested all of them in the desolate valleys, And in holes of the rocks, and on all the thorns, And on all the commendable things.
content_old: 19 And they have come, and rested all of them in the desolate valleys, And in holes of the rocks, and on all the thorns, And on all the commendable things.

content: 20 In that day doth the Lord shave, By a razor that is hired beyond the river, By the king of Asshur, The head, and the hair of the feet, Yea, also the beard it consumeth.
content_old: 20 In that day doth the Lord shave, By a razor that is hired beyond the river, By the king of Asshur, The head, and the hair of the feet, Yea, also the beard it consumeth.

content: 21 And it hath come to pass, in that day, A man keepeth alive a heifer of the herd, And two of the flock,
content_old: 21 And it hath come to pass, in that day, A man keepeth alive a heifer of the herd, And two of the flock,

content: 22 And it hath come to pass, From the abundance of the yielding of milk he eateth butter, For butter and honey doth every one eat Who is left in the heart of the land.
content_old: 22 And it hath come to pass, From the abundance of the yielding of milk he eateth butter, For butter and honey doth every one eat Who is left in the heart of the land.

content: 23 And it hath come to pass, in that day, Every place where there are a thousand vines, At a thousand silverlings, Is for briers and for thorns.
content_old: 23 And it hath come to pass, in that day, Every place where there are a thousand vines, At a thousand silverlings, Is for briers and for thorns.

content: 24 With arrows and with bow he cometh thither, Because all the land is brier and thorn.
content_old: 24 With arrows and with bow he cometh thither, Because all the land is brier and thorn.

content: 1 And Jehovah saith unto me, ‘Take to thee a great tablet, and write upon it with a graving tool of man, To haste spoil, enjoy prey.’
content_old: 1 And Jehovah saith unto me, ‘Take to thee a great tablet, and write upon it with a graving tool of man, To haste spoil, enjoy prey.’

content: 2 And I cause faithful witnesses to testify to me, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah.
content_old: 2 And I cause faithful witnesses to testify to me, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah.

content: 3 And I draw near unto the prophetess, and she conceiveth, and beareth a son; and Jehovah saith unto me, ‘Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz,
content_old: 3 And I draw near unto the prophetess, and she conceiveth, and beareth a son; and Jehovah saith unto me, ‘Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz,

content: 4 for before the youth doth know to cry, My father, and My mother, one taketh away the wealth of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria, before the king of Asshur.’
content_old: 4 for before the youth doth know to cry, My father, and My mother, one taketh away the wealth of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria, before the king of Asshur.’

content: 5 And Jehovah addeth to speak unto me again, saying:
content_old: 5 And Jehovah addeth to speak unto me again, saying:

content: 6 ‘Because that this people hath refused The waters of Shiloah that go softly, And is rejoicing with Rezin and the son of Remaliah,
content_old: 6 ‘Because that this people hath refused The waters of Shiloah that go softly, And is rejoicing with Rezin and the son of Remaliah,

content: 7 Therefore, lo, the Lord is bringing up on them, The waters of the river, the mighty and the great, (The king of Asshur, and all his glory,) And it hath gone up over all its streams, And hath gone on over all its banks.
content_old: 7 Therefore, lo, the Lord is bringing up on them, The waters of the river, the mighty and the great, (The king of Asshur, and all his glory,) And it hath gone up over all its streams, And hath gone on over all its banks.

content: 8 And it hath passed on into Judah, It hath overflown and passed over, Unto the neck it cometh, And the stretching out of its wings Hath been the fulness of the breadth of thy land, O Emmanu-El!
content_old: 8 And it hath passed on into Judah, It hath overflown and passed over, Unto the neck it cometh, And the stretching out of its wings Hath been the fulness of the breadth of thy land, O Emmanu-El!

content: 9 Be friends, O nations, and be broken, And give ear, all ye far off ones of earth, Gird yourselves, and be broken, Gird yourselves, and be broken.
content_old: 9 Be friends, O nations, and be broken, And give ear, all ye far off ones of earth, Gird yourselves, and be broken, Gird yourselves, and be broken.

content: 10 Take counsel, and it is broken, Speak a word, and it doth not stand, Because of Emmanu-El!’
content_old: 10 Take counsel, and it is broken, Speak a word, and it doth not stand, Because of Emmanu-El!’

content: 11 For thus hath Jehovah spoken unto me with strength of hand, and instructeth me against walking in the way of this people, saying,
content_old: 11 For thus hath Jehovah spoken unto me with strength of hand, and instructeth me against walking in the way of this people, saying,

content: 12 ‘Ye do not say, A confederacy, To all to whom this people saith, A confederacy, And its fear ye do not fear, Nor declare fearful.
content_old: 12 ‘Ye do not say, A confederacy, To all to whom this people saith, A confederacy, And its fear ye do not fear, Nor declare fearful.

content: 13 Jehovah of Hosts—Him ye do sanctify, And He is your Fear, and He your Dread,
content_old: 13 Jehovah of Hosts—Him ye do sanctify, And He is your Fear, and He your Dread,

content: 14 And He hath been for a sanctuary, And for a stone of stumbling, and for a rock of falling, To the two houses of Israel, For a gin and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
content_old: 14 And He hath been for a sanctuary, And for a stone of stumbling, and for a rock of falling, To the two houses of Israel, For a gin and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

content: 15 And many among them have stumbled and fallen, And been broken, and snared, and captured.
content_old: 15 And many among them have stumbled and fallen, And been broken, and snared, and captured.

content: 16 Bind up the testimony, Seal the law among My disciples.
content_old: 16 Bind up the testimony, Seal the law among My disciples.

content: 17 And I have waited for Jehovah, Who is hiding His face from the house of Jacob, And I have looked for Him.
content_old: 17 And I have waited for Jehovah, Who is hiding His face from the house of Jacob, And I have looked for Him.

content: 18 Lo, I, and the children whom Jehovah hath given to me, Are for signs and for wonders in Israel, From Jehovah of Hosts, who is dwelling in Mount Zion.
content_old: 18 Lo, I, and the children whom Jehovah hath given to me, Are for signs and for wonders in Israel, From Jehovah of Hosts, who is dwelling in Mount Zion.

content: 19 And when they say unto you, ‘Seek unto those having familiar spirits, And unto wizards, who chatter and mutter, Doth not a people seek unto its God?—For the living unto the dead!
content_old: 19 And when they say unto you, ‘Seek unto those having familiar spirits, And unto wizards, who chatter and mutter, Doth not a people seek unto its God?—For the living unto the dead!

content: 20 To the law and to the testimony! If not, let them say after this manner, ‘That there is no dawn to it.’
content_old: 20 To the law and to the testimony! If not, let them say after this manner, ‘That there is no dawn to it.’

content: 21 —And it hath passed over into it, hardened and hungry, And it hath come to pass, That it is hungry, and hath been wroth, And made light of its king, and of its God, And hath looked upwards.
content_old: 21 —And it hath passed over into it, hardened and hungry, And it hath come to pass, That it is hungry, and hath been wroth, And made light of its king, and of its God, And hath looked upwards.

content: 1 As the former time made light The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, So the latter hath honoured the way of the sea, Beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.
content_old: 1 As the former time made light The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, So the latter hath honoured the way of the sea, Beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.

content: 2 The people who are walking in darkness Have seen a great light, Dwellers in a land of death-shade, Light hath shone upon them.
content_old: 2 The people who are walking in darkness Have seen a great light, Dwellers in a land of death-shade, Light hath shone upon them.

content: 3 Thou hast multiplied the nation, Thou hast made great its joy, They have joyed before Thee as the joy in harvest, As men rejoice in their apportioning spoil.
content_old: 3 Thou hast multiplied the nation, Thou hast made great its joy, They have joyed before Thee as the joy in harvest, As men rejoice in their apportioning spoil.

content: 4 Because the yoke of its burden, And the staff of its shoulder, the rod of its exactor, Thou hast broken as in the day of Midian.
content_old: 4 Because the yoke of its burden, And the staff of its shoulder, the rod of its exactor, Thou hast broken as in the day of Midian.

content: 5 For every battle of a warrior is with rushing, and raiment rolled in blood, And it hath been for burning—fuel of fire.
content_old: 5 For every battle of a warrior is with rushing, and raiment rolled in blood, And it hath been for burning—fuel of fire.

content: 6 For a Child hath been born to us, A Son hath been given to us, And the princely power is on his shoulder, And He doth call his name Wonderful, Counsellor, Mighty God, Father of Eternity, Prince of Peace.
content_old: 6 For a Child hath been born to us, A Son hath been given to us, And the princely power is on his shoulder, And He doth call his name Wonderful, Counsellor, Mighty God, Father of Eternity, Prince of Peace.

content: 7 To the increase of the princely power, And of peace, there is no end, On the throne of David, and on his kingdom, To establish it, and to support it, In judgment and in righteousness, Henceforth, even unto the age, The zeal of Jehovah of Hosts doth this.
content_old: 7 To the increase of the princely power, And of peace, there is no end, On the throne of David, and on his kingdom, To establish it, and to support it, In judgment and in righteousness, Henceforth, even unto the age, The zeal of Jehovah of Hosts doth this.

content: 8 A word hath the Lord sent into Jacob, And it hath fallen in Israel.
content_old: 8 A word hath the Lord sent into Jacob, And it hath fallen in Israel.

content: 9 And the people have known—all of it, Ephraim, and the inhabitant of Samaria, In pride and in greatness of heart, saying,
content_old: 9 And the people have known—all of it, Ephraim, and the inhabitant of Samaria, In pride and in greatness of heart, saying,

content: 10 ‘Bricks have fallen, and hewn work we build, Sycamores have been cut down, and cedars we renew.’
content_old: 10 ‘Bricks have fallen, and hewn work we build, Sycamores have been cut down, and cedars we renew.’

content: 11 And Jehovah setteth the adversaries of Rezin on high above him, And his enemies he joineth together,
content_old: 11 And Jehovah setteth the adversaries of Rezin on high above him, And his enemies he joineth together,

content: 12 Aram from before, and Philistia from behind, And they devour Israel with the whole mouth. With all this not turned back hath His anger, And still His hand is stretched out.
content_old: 12 Aram from before, and Philistia from behind, And they devour Israel with the whole mouth. With all this not turned back hath His anger, And still His hand is stretched out.

content: 13 And the people hath not turned back unto Him who is smiting it, And Jehovah of Hosts they have not sought.
content_old: 13 And the people hath not turned back unto Him who is smiting it, And Jehovah of Hosts they have not sought.

content: 14 And Jehovah cutteth off from Israel head and tail, Branch and reed—the same day,
content_old: 14 And Jehovah cutteth off from Israel head and tail, Branch and reed—the same day,

content: 15 Elder, and accepted of face, he is the head, Prophet, teacher of falsehood, he is the tail.
content_old: 15 Elder, and accepted of face, he is the head, Prophet, teacher of falsehood, he is the tail.

content: 16 And the eulogists of this people are causing to err, And its eulogised ones are consumed.
content_old: 16 And the eulogists of this people are causing to err, And its eulogised ones are consumed.

content: 17 Therefore, over its young men the Lord rejoiceth not, And its orphans, and its widows He pitieth not, For every one is profane, and an evil doer, And every mouth is speaking folly. With all this not turned back hath His anger, And still His hand is stretched out.
content_old: 17 Therefore, over its young men the Lord rejoiceth not, And its orphans, and its widows He pitieth not, For every one is profane, and an evil doer, And every mouth is speaking folly. With all this not turned back hath His anger, And still His hand is stretched out.

content: 18 For burned as a fire hath wickedness, Brier and thorn it devoureth, And it kindleth in thickets of the forest, And they lift themselves up, an exaltation of smoke!
content_old: 18 For burned as a fire hath wickedness, Brier and thorn it devoureth, And it kindleth in thickets of the forest, And they lift themselves up, an exaltation of smoke!

content: 19 In the wrath of Jehovah of Hosts Hath the land been consumed, And the people is as fuel of fire; A man on his brother hath no pity,
content_old: 19 In the wrath of Jehovah of Hosts Hath the land been consumed, And the people is as fuel of fire; A man on his brother hath no pity,

content: 20 And cutteth down on the right, and hath been hungry, And he devoureth on the left, And they have not been satisfied, Each the flesh of his own arm they devour.
content_old: 20 And cutteth down on the right, and hath been hungry, And he devoureth on the left, And they have not been satisfied, Each the flesh of his own arm they devour.

content: 1 Woe to those decreeing decrees of iniquity, And writers who have prescribed perverseness.
content_old: 1 Woe to those decreeing decrees of iniquity, And writers who have prescribed perverseness.

content: 2 To turn aside from judgment the poor, And to take violently away the judgment Of the afflicted of My people, That widows may be their prey, That the fatherless they may spoil.
content_old: 2 To turn aside from judgment the poor, And to take violently away the judgment Of the afflicted of My people, That widows may be their prey, That the fatherless they may spoil.

content: 3 And what do ye at a day of inspection? And at desolation?—from afar it cometh. Near whom do ye flee for help? And where do ye leave your honour?
content_old: 3 And what do ye at a day of inspection? And at desolation?—from afar it cometh. Near whom do ye flee for help? And where do ye leave your honour?

content: 4 Without Me it hath bowed down In the place of a bound one, And in the place of the slain they fall. With all this not turned back hath His anger, And still His hand is stretched out.
content_old: 4 Without Me it hath bowed down In the place of a bound one, And in the place of the slain they fall. With all this not turned back hath His anger, And still His hand is stretched out.

content: 5 Woe to Asshur, a rod of Mine anger, And a staff in their hand is Mine indignation.
content_old: 5 Woe to Asshur, a rod of Mine anger, And a staff in their hand is Mine indignation.

content: 6 Against a profane nation I send him, And concerning a people of My wrath I charge him, To spoil spoil, and to seize prey, And to make it a treading-place as the clay of out places.
content_old: 6 Against a profane nation I send him, And concerning a people of My wrath I charge him, To spoil spoil, and to seize prey, And to make it a treading-place as the clay of out places.

content: 7 And he—he thinketh not so, And his heart reckoneth not so, For—to destroy is in his heart, And to cut off nations not a few.
content_old: 7 And he—he thinketh not so, And his heart reckoneth not so, For—to destroy is in his heart, And to cut off nations not a few.

content: 8 For he saith, ‘Are not my princes altogether kings?
content_old: 8 For he saith, ‘Are not my princes altogether kings?

content: 9 Is not Calno as Carchemish? Is not Hamath as Arpad? Is not Samaria as Damascus?
content_old: 9 Is not Calno as Carchemish? Is not Hamath as Arpad? Is not Samaria as Damascus?

content: 10 As my hand hath got to the kingdoms of a worthless thing, and their graven images, Greater than Jerusalem and than Samaria,
content_old: 10 As my hand hath got to the kingdoms of a worthless thing, and their graven images, Greater than Jerusalem and than Samaria,

content: 11 Do I not—as I have done to Samaria, And to her worthless things, So do to Jerusalem and to her grievous things?
content_old: 11 Do I not—as I have done to Samaria, And to her worthless things, So do to Jerusalem and to her grievous things?

content: 12 And it hath come to pass, When the Lord doth fulfil all His work In mount Zion and in Jerusalem, I see concerning the fruit of the greatness Of the heart of the king of Asshur. And concerning the glory of the height of his eyes.
content_old: 12 And it hath come to pass, When the Lord doth fulfil all His work In mount Zion and in Jerusalem, I see concerning the fruit of the greatness Of the heart of the king of Asshur. And concerning the glory of the height of his eyes.

content: 13 For he hath said, ‘By the power of my hand I have wrought, And by my wisdom, for I have been intelligent, And I remove borders of the peoples, And their chief ones I have spoiled, And I put down as a mighty one the inhabitants,
content_old: 13 For he hath said, ‘By the power of my hand I have wrought, And by my wisdom, for I have been intelligent, And I remove borders of the peoples, And their chief ones I have spoiled, And I put down as a mighty one the inhabitants,

content: 14 And my hand as to a nest Getteth to the wealth of the peoples, And as a gathering of forsaken eggs All the earth I—I have gathered, And there hath not been one moving wing, Or opening mouth, or whispering.’

content: 26 And awaking for him is Jehovah of Hosts, A scourge like the smiting of Midian at the rock Oreb, And his rod is over the sea, And he hath lifted it in the way of Egypt.

content: 2 Rested on him hath the Spirit of Jehovah, The spirit of wisdom and understanding, The spirit of counsel and might, The spirit of knowledge and fear of Jehovah.
content_old: 2 Rested on him hath the Spirit of Jehovah, The spirit of wisdom and understanding, The spirit of counsel and might, The spirit of knowledge and fear of Jehovah.

content: 3 To refresh him in the fear of Jehovah, And by the sight of his eyes he judgeth not, Nor by the hearing of his ears decideth.

content: 4 And he hath judged in righteousness the poor, And decided in uprightness for the humble of earth, And hath smitten earth with the rod of his mouth, And with the breath of his lips he putteth the wicked to death.

content: 5 And righteousness hath been the girdle of his loins, And faithfulness—the girdle of his reins.

content: 6 And a wolf hath sojourned with a lamb, And a leopard with a kid doth lie down, And calf, and young lion, and fatling are together, And a little youth is leader over them.
content_old: 6 And a wolf hath sojourned with a lamb, And a leopard with a kid doth lie down, And calf, and young lion, and fatling are together, And a little youth is leader over them.

content: 7 And cow and bear do feed, Together lie down their young ones, And a lion as an ox eateth straw.

content: 8 And played hath a suckling by the hole of an asp, And on the den of a cockatrice Hath the weaned one put his hand.

content: 9 Evil they do not, nor destroy in all My holy mountain, For full hath been the earth with the knowledge of Jehovah, As the waters are covering the sea.

content: 10 And there hath been, in that day, A root of Jesse that is standing for an ensign of peoples, Unto him do nations seek, And his rest hath been—honour!
content_old: 10 And there hath been, in that day, A root of Jesse that is standing for an ensign of peoples, Unto him do nations seek, And his rest hath been—honour!

content: 11 And it hath come to pass, in that day, The Lord addeth a second time his power, To get the remnant of His people that is left, From Asshur, and from Egypt, And from Pathros, and from Cush, And from Elam, and from Shinar, And from Hamath, and from isles of the sea,

content: 13 And turned aside hath the envy of Ephraim, And the adversaries of Judah are cut off, Ephraim doth not envy Judah, And Judah doth not distress Ephraim.

content: 14 And they have flown on the shoulder of the Philistines westward, Together they spoil the sons of the east, Edom and Moab sending forth their hand, And sons of Ammon obeying them.

content: 15 And Jehovah hath devoted to destruction The tongue of the sea of Egypt, And hath waved His hand over the river, In the terror of his wind, And hath smitten it at the seven streams, And hath caused men to tread it with shoes.

content: 4 And ye have said in that day, Give ye praise to Jehovah, call in His name. Make known among the peoples His acts. Make mention that set on high is His name.

content: 2 ‘On a high mountain lift ye up an ensign, Raise the voice to them, wave the hand, And they go in to the openings of nobles.

content: 3 I have given charge to My sanctified ones, Also I have called My mighty ones for Mine anger, Those rejoicing at Mine excellency.’
content_old: 3 I have given charge to My sanctified ones, Also I have called My mighty ones for Mine anger, Those rejoicing at Mine excellency.’

content: 4 A voice of a multitude in the mountains, A likeness of a numerous people, A voice of noise from the kingdoms of nations who are gathered, Jehovah of Hosts inspecting a host of battle!
content_old: 4 A voice of a multitude in the mountains, A likeness of a numerous people, A voice of noise from the kingdoms of nations who are gathered, Jehovah of Hosts inspecting a host of battle!

content: 5 They are coming in from a land afar off, From the end of the heavens, Jehovah and the instruments of His indignation, To destroy all the land.
content_old: 5 They are coming in from a land afar off, From the end of the heavens, Jehovah and the instruments of His indignation, To destroy all the land.

content: 6 Howl ye, for near is the day of Jehovah, As destruction from the Mighty it cometh.
content_old: 6 Howl ye, for near is the day of Jehovah, As destruction from the Mighty it cometh.

content: 7 Therefore, all hands do fail, And every heart of man doth melt.

content: 8 And they have been troubled, Pains and pangs they take, As a travailing woman they are pained, A man at his friend they marvel, The appearance of flames—their faces!

content: 10 For the stars of the heavens, and their constellations, Cause not their light to shine, Darkened hath been the sun in its going out, And the moon causeth not its light to come forth.

content: 12 I make man more rare than fine gold, And a common man than pure gold of Ophir.
content_old: 12 I make man more rare than fine gold, And a common man than pure gold of Ophir.

content: 13 Therefore the heavens I cause to tremble, And the earth doth shake from its place, In the wrath of Jehovah of Hosts, And in a day of the heat of his anger.
content_old: 13 Therefore the heavens I cause to tremble, And the earth doth shake from its place, In the wrath of Jehovah of Hosts, And in a day of the heat of his anger.

content: 14 And it hath been, as a roe driven away, And as a flock that hath no gatherer, Each unto his people—they turn, And each unto his land—they flee.

content: 15 Every one who is found is thrust through, And every one who is added falleth by sword.
content_old: 15 Every one who is found is thrust through, And every one who is added falleth by sword.

content: 16 And their sucklings are dashed to pieces before their eyes, Spoiled are their houses, and their wives lain with.
content_old: 16 And their sucklings are dashed to pieces before their eyes, Spoiled are their houses, and their wives lain with.

content: 17 Lo, I am stirring up against them the Medes, Who silver esteem not, And gold—they delight not in it.

content: 18 And bows dash young men to pieces, And the fruit of the womb they pity not, On sons their eye hath no pity.

content: 19 And Babylon, the beauty of kingdoms, The glory, the excellency of the Chaldeans, Hath been as overthrown by God, With Sodom and with Gomorrah.
content_old: 19 And Babylon, the beauty of kingdoms, The glory, the excellency of the Chaldeans, Hath been as overthrown by God, With Sodom and with Gomorrah.

content: 20 She doth not sit for ever, Nor continueth unto many generations, Nor doth Arab pitch tent there, And shepherds lie not down there.

content: 21 And Ziim have lain down there, And full have been their houses of howlings, And dwelt there have daughters of an ostrich, And goats do skip there.

content: 1 Because Jehovah loveth Jacob, And hath fixed again on Israel, And given them rest on their own land, And joined hath been the sojourner to them, And they have been admitted to the house of Jacob.

content: 2 And peoples have taken them, And have brought them in unto their place, And the house of Israel have inherited them, On the land of Jehovah, For men-servants and for maid-servants, And they have been captors of their captors, And have ruled over their exactors.
content_old: 2 And peoples have taken them, And have brought them in unto their place, And the house of Israel have inherited them, On the land of Jehovah, For men-servants and for maid-servants, And they have been captors of their captors, And have ruled over their exactors.

content: 3 And it hath come to pass, In the day of Jehovah’s giving rest to thee, From thy grief, and from thy trouble, And from the sharp bondage, That hath been served upon thee,
content_old: 3 And it hath come to pass, In the day of Jehovah’s giving rest to thee, From thy grief, and from thy trouble, And from the sharp bondage, That hath been served upon thee,

content: 4 That thou hast taken up this simile Concerning the king of Babylon, and said, How hath the exactor ceased,
content_old: 4 That thou hast taken up this simile Concerning the king of Babylon, and said, How hath the exactor ceased,

content: 5 Ceased hath the golden one. Broken hath Jehovah the staff of the wicked, The sceptre of rulers.
content_old: 5 Ceased hath the golden one. Broken hath Jehovah the staff of the wicked, The sceptre of rulers.

content: 6 He who is smiting peoples in wrath, A smiting without intermission, He who is ruling in anger nations, Pursuing without restraint!
content_old: 6 He who is smiting peoples in wrath, A smiting without intermission, He who is ruling in anger nations, Pursuing without restraint!

content: 7 At rest—quiet hath been all the earth, They have broken forth into singing.

content: 8 Even firs have rejoiced over thee, Cedars of Lebanon—saying: Since thou hast lain down, The hewer cometh not up against us.

content_old: 9 Sheol beneath hath been troubled at thee, To meet thy coming in, It is waking up for thee Rephaim, All chiefs ones of earth, It hath raised up from their thrones All kings of nations.

content_old: 10 All of them answer and say unto thee, Even thou hast become weak like us! Unto us thou hast become like!

content: 11 Brought down to Sheol hath been thine excellency, The noise of thy psaltery, Under thee spread out hath been the worm, Yea, covering thee is the worm.
content_old: 11 Brought down to Sheol hath been thine excellency, The noise of thy psaltery, Under thee spread out hath been the worm, Yea, covering thee is the worm.

content_old: 12 How hast thou fallen from the heavens, O shining one, son of the dawn! Thou hast been cut down to earth, O weakener of nations.

content: 14 I go up above the heights of a thick cloud, I am like to the Most High.

content: 15 Only—unto Sheol thou art brought down, Unto the sides of the pit.

content: 16 Thy beholders look to thee, to thee they attend, Is this the man causing the earth to tremble, Shaking kingdoms?

content: 18 All kings of nations—all of them, Have lain down in honour, each in his house,

content: 19 And—thou hast been cast out of thy grave, As an abominable branch, raiment of the slain, Thrust through ones of the sword, Going down unto the sons of the pit, As a carcase trodden down.
content_old: 19 And—thou hast been cast out of thy grave, As an abominable branch, raiment of the slain, Thrust through ones of the sword, Going down unto the sons of the pit, As a carcase trodden down.

content: 20 Thou art not united with them in burial, For thy land thou hast destroyed, Thy people thou hast slain, Not named to the age is the seed of evil doers.

content: 21 Prepare ye for his sons slaughter; Because of the iniquity of their fathers, They rise not, nor have possessed the land, Nor filled the face of the world with cities.

content: 23 And have made it for a possession of a bittern, And ponds of waters, And daubed it with the mire of destruction, The affirmation of Jehovah of Hosts!
content_old: 23 And have made it for a possession of a bittern, And ponds of waters, And daubed it with the mire of destruction, The affirmation of Jehovah of Hosts!

content: 25 To break Asshur in My land, And on My mountains I tread him down, And turned from off them hath his yoke, Yea, his burden from off their shoulder turneth aside.

content: 8 For gone round hath the cry the border of Moab, Unto Eglaim is its howling, And to Beer-Elim is its howling.

content: 1 Send ye a lamb to the ruler of the land, From Selah in the wilderness, Unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.
content_old: 1 Send ye a lamb to the ruler of the land, From Selah in the wilderness, Unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.

content: 2 And it hath come to pass, As a wandering bird, a nest cast out, Are daughters of Moab, at fords of Arnon.
content_old: 2 And it hath come to pass, As a wandering bird, a nest cast out, Are daughters of Moab, at fords of Arnon.

content: 3 Bring ye in counsel, do judgment, Make as night thy shadow in the midst of noon, Hide outcasts, the wanderer reveal not.
content_old: 3 Bring ye in counsel, do judgment, Make as night thy shadow in the midst of noon, Hide outcasts, the wanderer reveal not.

content: 4 Sojourn in thee do My outcasts, O Moab, Be a secret hiding-place to them, From the face of a destroyer, For ceased hath the extortioner, Finished hath been a destroyer, Consumed the treaders down out of the land.

content: 5 And established in kindness is the throne, And one hath sat on it in truth, in the tent of David, Judging and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness.

content: 6 We have heard of the pride of Moab—very proud, His pride, and his arrogance, and his wrath, Not right are his devices.
content_old: 6 We have heard of the pride of Moab—very proud, His pride, and his arrogance, and his wrath, Not right are his devices.

content: 7 Therefore howl doth Moab for Moab, all of it doth howl, For the grape-cakes of Kir-Hareseth it meditateth, Surely they are smitten.
content_old: 7 Therefore howl doth Moab for Moab, all of it doth howl, For the grape-cakes of Kir-Hareseth it meditateth, Surely they are smitten.

content: 8 Because fields of Heshbon languish, The vine of Sibmah, Lords of nations did beat her choice vines, Unto Jazer they have come, They have wandered in a wilderness, Her plants have spread themselves, They have passed over a sea.

content: 9 Therefore I weep with the weeping of Jazer, The vine of Sibmah, I water thee with my tear, O Heshbon and Elealeh, For—for thy summer fruits, and for thy harvest, The shouting hath fallen.
content_old: 9 Therefore I weep with the weeping of Jazer, The vine of Sibmah, I water thee with my tear, O Heshbon and Elealeh, For—for thy summer fruits, and for thy harvest, The shouting hath fallen.

content: 10 And removed have been gladness and joy from the fruitful field, And in vineyards they sing not, nor shout, Wine in the presses treadeth not the treader, Shouting I have caused to cease.

content: 11 Therefore my bowels for Moab as a harp do sound, And mine inward parts for Kir-Haresh.
content_old: 11 Therefore my bowels for Moab as a harp do sound, And mine inward parts for Kir-Haresh.

content: 12 And it hath come to pass, when it hath been seen, That weary hath been Moab on the high place, And he hath come unto his sanctuary to pray, And is not able.

content: 1 The burden of Damascus. Lo, Damascus is taken away from being a city, And it hath been a heap—a ruin.
content_old: 1 The burden of Damascus. Lo, Damascus is taken away from being a city, And it hath been a heap—a ruin.

content: 2 Forsaken are the cities of Aroer, For droves they are, and they have lain down, And there is none troubling.
content_old: 2 Forsaken are the cities of Aroer, For droves they are, and they have lain down, And there is none troubling.

content: 3 And ceased hath the fortress from Ephraim, And the kingdom from Damascus, And the remnant of Aram are as the honour of the sons of Israel, The affirmation of Jehovah of Hosts!
content_old: 3 And ceased hath the fortress from Ephraim, And the kingdom from Damascus, And the remnant of Aram are as the honour of the sons of Israel, The affirmation of Jehovah of Hosts!

content: 4 And it hath come to pass, in that day, Wax poor doth the honour of Jacob, And the fatness of his flesh doth wax lean.
content_old: 4 And it hath come to pass, in that day, Wax poor doth the honour of Jacob, And the fatness of his flesh doth wax lean.

content: 5 And it hath come to pass, As the gathering by the reaper of the standing corn, And his arm the ears reapeth, And it hath come to pass, As the gathering of the ears in the valley of Rephaim,
content_old: 5 And it hath come to pass, As the gathering by the reaper of the standing corn, And his arm the ears reapeth, And it hath come to pass, As the gathering of the ears in the valley of Rephaim,

content: 6 And left in him have been gleanings, As the compassing of an olive, Two—three berries on the top of a branch, Four—five on the fruitful boughs, The affirmation of Jehovah, God of Israel!
content_old: 6 And left in him have been gleanings, As the compassing of an olive, Two—three berries on the top of a branch, Four—five on the fruitful boughs, The affirmation of Jehovah, God of Israel!

content: 7 In that day doth man look to His Maker, Yea, his eyes to the Holy One of Israel look,
content_old: 7 In that day doth man look to His Maker, Yea, his eyes to the Holy One of Israel look,

content: 8 And he looketh not unto the altars. The work of his own hands, And that which his own fingers made He seeth not—the shrines and the images.
content_old: 8 And he looketh not unto the altars. The work of his own hands, And that which his own fingers made He seeth not—the shrines and the images.

content: 9 In that day are the cities of his strength As the forsaken thing of the forest, And the branch that they have left, Because of the sons of Israel, It also hath been a desolation.
content_old: 9 In that day are the cities of his strength As the forsaken thing of the forest, And the branch that they have left, Because of the sons of Israel, It also hath been a desolation.

content: 10 Because thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, And the rock of thy strength hast not remembered, Therefore thou plantest plants of pleasantness, And with a strange slip sowest it,
content_old: 10 Because thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, And the rock of thy strength hast not remembered, Therefore thou plantest plants of pleasantness, And with a strange slip sowest it,

content: 11 In the day thy plant thou causest to become great, And in the morning thy seed makest to flourish, A heap is the harvest in a day of overflowing, And of mortal pain.
content_old: 11 In the day thy plant thou causest to become great, And in the morning thy seed makest to flourish, A heap is the harvest in a day of overflowing, And of mortal pain.

content: 12 Woe to the multitude of many peoples, As the sounding of seas they sound; And to the wasting of nations, As the wasting of mighty waters they are wasted.
content_old: 12 Woe to the multitude of many peoples, As the sounding of seas they sound; And to the wasting of nations, As the wasting of mighty waters they are wasted.

content: 13 Nations as the wasting of many waters are wasted, And He hath pushed against it, And it hath fled afar off, And been pursued as chaff of hills before wind, And as a rolling thing before a hurricane.
