content: 2 O Jehovah, favour us, for thee we have waited, Be their arm, in the mornings, Yea, our salvation in time of adversity.
content_old: 2 O Jehovah, favour us, for thee we have waited, Be their arm, in the mornings, Yea, our salvation in time of adversity.

content: 3 From the voice of a multitude fled have peoples, From thine exaltation scattered have been nations.
content_old: 3 From the voice of a multitude fled have peoples, From thine exaltation scattered have been nations.

content: 4 And gathered hath been your spoil, A gathering of the caterpillar, As a running to and fro of locusts is he running on it.
content_old: 4 And gathered hath been your spoil, A gathering of the caterpillar, As a running to and fro of locusts is he running on it.

content: 5 Set on high is Jehovah, for He is dwelling on high, He filled Zion with judgment and righteousness,
content_old: 5 Set on high is Jehovah, for He is dwelling on high, He filled Zion with judgment and righteousness,

content: 6 And hath been the stedfastness of thy times, The strength of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge, Fear of Jehovah—it is His treasure.
content_old: 6 And hath been the stedfastness of thy times, The strength of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge, Fear of Jehovah—it is His treasure.

content: 7 Lo, ‘Their Ariel,’ they have cried without, Messengers of peace do weep bitterly.
content_old: 7 Lo, ‘Their Ariel,’ they have cried without, Messengers of peace do weep bitterly.

content: 8 Desolated have been highways, Ceased hath he who passeth along the path, He hath broken covenant, He hath despised enemies, He hath not esteemed a man.
content_old: 8 Desolated have been highways, Ceased hath he who passeth along the path, He hath broken covenant, He hath despised enemies, He hath not esteemed a man.

content: 9 Mourned, languished hath the land, Confounded hath been Lebanon, Withered hath been Sharon as a wilderness, And shaking are Bashan and Carmel.
content_old: 9 Mourned, languished hath the land, Confounded hath been Lebanon, Withered hath been Sharon as a wilderness, And shaking are Bashan and Carmel.

content: 10 Now, do I arise, saith Jehovah, Now I am exalted, now I am lifted up.
content_old: 10 Now, do I arise, saith Jehovah, Now I am exalted, now I am lifted up.

content: 11 Ye conceive chaff, ye bear stubble, Your spirit!—fire devoureth you.
content_old: 11 Ye conceive chaff, ye bear stubble, Your spirit!—fire devoureth you.

content: 12 And peoples have been as burnings of lime, Thorns, as sweepings, with fire they burn.
content_old: 12 And peoples have been as burnings of lime, Thorns, as sweepings, with fire they burn.

content: 13 Hear, ye far off, that which I have done, And know, ye near ones, My might.
content_old: 13 Hear, ye far off, that which I have done, And know, ye near ones, My might.

content: 14 Afraid in Zion have been sinners, Seized hath trembling the profane: Who doth dwell for us—consuming fire, Who doth dwell for us—burnings of the age?
content_old: 14 Afraid in Zion have been sinners, Seized hath trembling the profane: Who doth dwell for us—consuming fire, Who doth dwell for us—burnings of the age?

content: 15 Whoso is walking righteously, And is speaking uprightly, Kicking against gain of oppressions, Shaking his hands from taking hold on a bribe, Stopping his ear from hearing of blood, And shutting his eyes from looking on evil,
content_old: 15 Whoso is walking righteously, And is speaking uprightly, Kicking against gain of oppressions, Shaking his hands from taking hold on a bribe, Stopping his ear from hearing of blood, And shutting his eyes from looking on evil,

content: 16 He high places doth inhabit, Strongholds of rock are his high tower, His bread hath been given, his waters stedfast.
content_old: 16 He high places doth inhabit, Strongholds of rock are his high tower, His bread hath been given, his waters stedfast.

content: 17 A king in his beauty, see do thine eyes, They see a land afar off.
content_old: 17 A king in his beauty, see do thine eyes, They see a land afar off.

content: 18 Thy heart doth meditate terror, Where is he who is counting? Where is he who is weighing? Where is he who is counting the towers?
content_old: 18 Thy heart doth meditate terror, Where is he who is counting? Where is he who is weighing? Where is he who is counting the towers?

content: 19 The strong people thou seest not, A people deeper of lip than to be understood, Of a scorned tongue, there is no understanding.
content_old: 19 The strong people thou seest not, A people deeper of lip than to be understood, Of a scorned tongue, there is no understanding.

content: 20 See Zion, the city of our meetings, Thine eyes see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, A tent not taken down, Not removed are its pins for ever, And none of its cords are broken.
content_old: 20 See Zion, the city of our meetings, Thine eyes see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, A tent not taken down, Not removed are its pins for ever, And none of its cords are broken.

content: 21 But there mighty is Jehovah for us, A place of rivers—streams broad of sides, No ship with oars doth go into it, And a mighty ship doth not pass over it.
content_old: 21 But there mighty is Jehovah for us, A place of rivers—streams broad of sides, No ship with oars doth go into it, And a mighty ship doth not pass over it.

content: 22 For Jehovah our judge, Jehovah our lawgiver, Jehovah our king—He doth save us.
content_old: 22 For Jehovah our judge, Jehovah our lawgiver, Jehovah our king—He doth save us.

content: 23 Left have been thy ropes, They strengthen not rightly their mast, They have not spread out a sail, Then apportioned hath been a prey of much spoil, The lame have taken spoil.
content_old: 23 Left have been thy ropes, They strengthen not rightly their mast, They have not spread out a sail, Then apportioned hath been a prey of much spoil, The lame have taken spoil.

content: 1 Come near, ye nations, to hear, And ye peoples, give attention, Hear doth the earth and its fulness, The world, and all its productions.
content_old: 1 Come near, ye nations, to hear, And ye peoples, give attention, Hear doth the earth and its fulness, The world, and all its productions.

content: 2 For wrath is to Jehovah against all the nations, And fury against all their host, He hath devoted them to destruction, He hath given them to slaughter.
content_old: 2 For wrath is to Jehovah against all the nations, And fury against all their host, He hath devoted them to destruction, He hath given them to slaughter.

content: 3 And their wounded are cast out, And their carcases cause their stench to ascend, And melted have been mountains from their blood.
content_old: 3 And their wounded are cast out, And their carcases cause their stench to ascend, And melted have been mountains from their blood.

content: 4 And consumed have been all the host of the heavens, And rolled together as a book have been the heavens, And all their hosts do fade, As the fading of a leaf of a vine, And as the fading one of a fig-tree.
content_old: 4 And consumed have been all the host of the heavens, And rolled together as a book have been the heavens, And all their hosts do fade, As the fading of a leaf of a vine, And as the fading one of a fig-tree.

content: 5 For soaked in the heavens was My sword, Lo, on Edom it cometh down, On the people of My curse for judgment.
content_old: 5 For soaked in the heavens was My sword, Lo, on Edom it cometh down, On the people of My curse for judgment.

content: 6 A sword is to Jehovah—it hath been full of blood, It hath been made fat with fatness, With blood of lambs and he-goats. With fat of kidneys of rams, For a sacrifice is to Jehovah in Bozrah, And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
content_old: 6 A sword is to Jehovah—it hath been full of blood, It hath been made fat with fatness, With blood of lambs and he-goats. With fat of kidneys of rams, For a sacrifice is to Jehovah in Bozrah, And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

content: 7 And come down have reems with them, And bullocks with bulls, And soaked hath been their land from blood, And their dust from fatness is made fat.
content_old: 7 And come down have reems with them, And bullocks with bulls, And soaked hath been their land from blood, And their dust from fatness is made fat.

content: 8 (For a day of vengeance is to Jehovah, A year of recompences for Zion’s strife,)
content_old: 8 (For a day of vengeance is to Jehovah, A year of recompences for Zion’s strife,)

content: 9 And turned have been her streams to pitch, And her dust to brimstone, And her land hath become burning pitch.
content_old: 9 And turned have been her streams to pitch, And her dust to brimstone, And her land hath become burning pitch.

content: 10 By night and by day she is not quenched, To the age go up doth her smoke, From generation to generation she is waste, For ever and ever, none is passing into her.
content_old: 10 By night and by day she is not quenched, To the age go up doth her smoke, From generation to generation she is waste, For ever and ever, none is passing into her.

content: 11 And possess her do pelican and hedge-hog, And owl and raven dwell in her, And He hath stretched out over her A line of vacancy, and stones of emptiness.
content_old: 11 And possess her do pelican and hedge-hog, And owl and raven dwell in her, And He hath stretched out over her A line of vacancy, and stones of emptiness.

content: 12 To the kingdom her freemen they call, But there are none there, And all her princes are at an end.
content_old: 12 To the kingdom her freemen they call, But there are none there, And all her princes are at an end.

content: 13 And gone up her palaces have thorns, Nettle and bramble are in her fortresses, And it hath been a habitation of dragons, A court for daughters of an ostrich.
content_old: 13 And gone up her palaces have thorns, Nettle and bramble are in her fortresses, And it hath been a habitation of dragons, A court for daughters of an ostrich.

content: 14 And met have Ziim with Aiim, And the goat for its companion calleth, Only there rested hath the night-owl, And hath found for herself a place of rest.
content_old: 14 And met have Ziim with Aiim, And the goat for its companion calleth, Only there rested hath the night-owl, And hath found for herself a place of rest.

content: 15 There made her nest hath the bittern, Yea, she layeth, and hath hatched, And hath gathered under her shadow, Only there gathered have been vultures, Each with its companion.
content_old: 15 There made her nest hath the bittern, Yea, she layeth, and hath hatched, And hath gathered under her shadow, Only there gathered have been vultures, Each with its companion.

content: 16 Seek out of the book of Jehovah, and read, One of these hath not been lacking, None hath missed its companion, For My mouth—it hath commanded, And His spirit—He hath gathered them.
content_old: 16 Seek out of the book of Jehovah, and read, One of these hath not been lacking, None hath missed its companion, For My mouth—it hath commanded, And His spirit—He hath gathered them.

content: 1 They joy from the wilderness and dry place, And rejoice doth the desert, and flourish as the rose,
content_old: 1 They joy from the wilderness and dry place, And rejoice doth the desert, and flourish as the rose,

content: 2 Flourishing it doth flourish, and rejoice, Yea, with joy and singing, The honour of Lebanon hath been given to it, The beauty of Carmel and Sharon, They—they see the honour of Jehovah, The majesty of our God.
content_old: 2 Flourishing it doth flourish, and rejoice, Yea, with joy and singing, The honour of Lebanon hath been given to it, The beauty of Carmel and Sharon, They—they see the honour of Jehovah, The majesty of our God.

content: 3 Strengthen ye the feeble hands, Yea, the stumbling knees strengthen.
content_old: 3 Strengthen ye the feeble hands, Yea, the stumbling knees strengthen.

content: 4 Say to the hastened of heart, ‘Be strong, Fear not, lo, your God; vengeance cometh, The recompence of God, He Himself doth come and save you.’
content_old: 4 Say to the hastened of heart, ‘Be strong, Fear not, lo, your God; vengeance cometh, The recompence of God, He Himself doth come and save you.’

content: 5 Then opened are eyes of the blind, And ears of the deaf are unstopped,
content_old: 5 Then opened are eyes of the blind, And ears of the deaf are unstopped,

content: 6 Then leap as a hart doth the lame, And sing doth the tongue of the dumb, For broken up in a wilderness have been waters, And streams in a desert.
content_old: 6 Then leap as a hart doth the lame, And sing doth the tongue of the dumb, For broken up in a wilderness have been waters, And streams in a desert.

content: 7 And the mirage hath become a pond, And the thirsty land fountains of waters, In the habitation of dragons, Its place of couching down, a court for reed and rush.
content_old: 7 And the mirage hath become a pond, And the thirsty land fountains of waters, In the habitation of dragons, Its place of couching down, a court for reed and rush.

content: 8 And a highway hath been there, and a way, And the ‘way of holiness’ is called to it, Not pass over it doth the unclean, And He Himself is by them, Whoso is going in the way—even fools err not.
content_old: 8 And a highway hath been there, and a way, And the ‘way of holiness’ is called to it, Not pass over it doth the unclean, And He Himself is by them, Whoso is going in the way—even fools err not.

content: 9 No lion is there, yea, a destructive beast Ascendeth it not, it is not found there, And walked have the redeemed,
content_old: 9 No lion is there, yea, a destructive beast Ascendeth it not, it is not found there, And walked have the redeemed,

content: 1 And it cometh to pass, in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, come up hath Sennacherib king of Asshur against all the fenced cities of Judah, and seizeth them.
content_old: 1 And it cometh to pass, in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, come up hath Sennacherib king of Asshur against all the fenced cities of Judah, and seizeth them.

content: 2 And the king of Asshur sendeth Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem, unto the king Hezekiah, with a heavy force, and he standeth by the conduit of the upper pool, in the highway of the fuller’s field,
content_old: 2 And the king of Asshur sendeth Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem, unto the king Hezekiah, with a heavy force, and he standeth by the conduit of the upper pool, in the highway of the fuller’s field,

content: 3 and go forth unto him doth Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who is over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph, the remembrancer.
content_old: 3 and go forth unto him doth Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who is over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph, the remembrancer.

content: 4 And Rabshakeh saith unto them, ‘Say ye, I pray you, unto Hezekiah, ‘Thus said the great king, the king of Asshur, What is this confidence in which thou hast confided?
content_old: 4 And Rabshakeh saith unto them, ‘Say ye, I pray you, unto Hezekiah, ‘Thus said the great king, the king of Asshur, What is this confidence in which thou hast confided?

content: 5 I have said: Only, a word of the lips! counsel and might are for battle: now, on whom hast thou trusted, that thou hast rebelled against me?
content_old: 5 I have said: Only, a word of the lips! counsel and might are for battle: now, on whom hast thou trusted, that thou hast rebelled against me?

content: 6 ‘Lo, thou hast trusted on the staff of this broken reed—on Egypt—which a man leaneth on, and it hath gone into his hand, and pierced it—so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all those trusting on him.
content_old: 6 ‘Lo, thou hast trusted on the staff of this broken reed—on Egypt—which a man leaneth on, and it hath gone into his hand, and pierced it—so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all those trusting on him.

content: 7 ‘And dost thou say unto me, Unto Jehovah our God we have trusted? is it not He, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath turned aside, and saith to Judah and to Jerusalem, Before this altar ye do bow yourselves?
content_old: 7 ‘And dost thou say unto me, Unto Jehovah our God we have trusted? is it not He, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath turned aside, and saith to Judah and to Jerusalem, Before this altar ye do bow yourselves?

content: 8 ‘And now, negotiate, I pray thee, with my lord the king of Asshur, and I give to thee two thousand horses, if thou art able to put for thee riders on them.
content_old: 8 ‘And now, negotiate, I pray thee, with my lord the king of Asshur, and I give to thee two thousand horses, if thou art able to put for thee riders on them.

content: 9 And how dost thou turn back the face of one captain of the least of the servants of my lord, and dost trust for thee on Egypt, for chariot and for horsemen?
content_old: 9 And how dost thou turn back the face of one captain of the least of the servants of my lord, and dost trust for thee on Egypt, for chariot and for horsemen?

content: 10 And now, without Jehovah have I come up against this land to destroy it? Jehovah said unto me, Go up unto this land, and thou hast destroyed it.’
content_old: 10 And now, without Jehovah have I come up against this land to destroy it? Jehovah said unto me, Go up unto this land, and thou hast destroyed it.’

content: 11 And Eliakim saith—and Shebna and Joah—unto Rabshakeh, ‘Speak, we pray thee, unto thy servants in Aramaean, for we are understanding; and do not speak unto us in Jewish, in the ears of the people who are on the wall.’
content_old: 11 And Eliakim saith—and Shebna and Joah—unto Rabshakeh, ‘Speak, we pray thee, unto thy servants in Aramaean, for we are understanding; and do not speak unto us in Jewish, in the ears of the people who are on the wall.’

content: 12 And Rabshakeh saith, ‘Unto thy lord, and unto thee, hath my lord sent me to speak these words? is it not for the men—those sitting on the wall to eat their own dung and to drink their own water with you?’
content_old: 12 And Rabshakeh saith, ‘Unto thy lord, and unto thee, hath my lord sent me to speak these words? is it not for the men—those sitting on the wall to eat their own dung and to drink their own water with you?’

content: 13 And Rabshakeh standeth and calleth with a great voice in Jewish, and saith, ‘Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Asshur:
content_old: 13 And Rabshakeh standeth and calleth with a great voice in Jewish, and saith, ‘Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Asshur:

content: 14 Thus said the king, Let not Hezekiah lift you up, for he is not able to deliver you;
content_old: 14 Thus said the king, Let not Hezekiah lift you up, for he is not able to deliver you;

content: 15 and let not Hezekiah make you trust unto Jehovah, saying, Jehovah doth certainly deliver us, this city is not given into the hand of the king of Asshur.
content_old: 15 and let not Hezekiah make you trust unto Jehovah, saying, Jehovah doth certainly deliver us, this city is not given into the hand of the king of Asshur.

content: 16 ‘Do not hearken unto Hezekiah, for thus said the king of Asshur, Make ye with me a blessing, and come out unto me, and eat ye each of his vine, and each of his fig-tree, and drink ye each the waters of his own well,
content_old: 16 ‘Do not hearken unto Hezekiah, for thus said the king of Asshur, Make ye with me a blessing, and come out unto me, and eat ye each of his vine, and each of his fig-tree, and drink ye each the waters of his own well,

content: 17 till my coming in, and I have taken you unto a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards;
content_old: 17 till my coming in, and I have taken you unto a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards;

content: 18 lest Hezekiah doth persuade you, saying, Jehovah doth deliver us. ‘Have the gods of the nations delivered each his land out of the hand of the king of Asshur?
content_old: 18 lest Hezekiah doth persuade you, saying, Jehovah doth deliver us. ‘Have the gods of the nations delivered each his land out of the hand of the king of Asshur?

content: 19 Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where the gods of Sepharvaim, that they have delivered Samaria out of my hand?
content_old: 19 Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where the gods of Sepharvaim, that they have delivered Samaria out of my hand?

content: 20 Who among all the gods of these lands are they who have delivered their land out of my hand, that Jehovah doth deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?’
content_old: 20 Who among all the gods of these lands are they who have delivered their land out of my hand, that Jehovah doth deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?’

content: 21 And they keep silent, and have not answered him a word, for a command of the king is, saying, ‘Do not answer him.’
content_old: 21 And they keep silent, and have not answered him a word, for a command of the king is, saying, ‘Do not answer him.’

content: 1 And it cometh to pass, at the king Hezekiah’s hearing, that he rendeth his garments, and covereth himself with sackcloth, and entereth the house of Jehovah,
content_old: 1 And it cometh to pass, at the king Hezekiah’s hearing, that he rendeth his garments, and covereth himself with sackcloth, and entereth the house of Jehovah,

content: 2 and sendeth Eliakim, who is over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covering themselves with sackcloth, unto Isaiah son of Amoz the prophet,
content_old: 2 and sendeth Eliakim, who is over the house, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covering themselves with sackcloth, unto Isaiah son of Amoz the prophet,

content: 3 and they say unto him, ‘Thus said Hezekiah, A day of distress, and rebuke, and despising, is this day; for come have sons unto the birth, and power there is not to bear.
content_old: 3 and they say unto him, ‘Thus said Hezekiah, A day of distress, and rebuke, and despising, is this day; for come have sons unto the birth, and power there is not to bear.

content: 4 ‘It may be Jehovah thy God doth hear the words of Rabshakeh with which the king of Asshur his lord hath sent him to reproach the living God, and hath decided concerning the words that Jehovah thy God hath heard, and thou hast lifted up prayer for the remnant that is found.’
content_old: 4 ‘It may be Jehovah thy God doth hear the words of Rabshakeh with which the king of Asshur his lord hath sent him to reproach the living God, and hath decided concerning the words that Jehovah thy God hath heard, and thou hast lifted up prayer for the remnant that is found.’

content: 5 And the servants of king Hezekiah come in unto Isaiah,
content_old: 5 And the servants of king Hezekiah come in unto Isaiah,

content: 6 and Isaiah saith unto them, ‘Thus do ye say unto your lord, Thus said Jehovah, Be not afraid because of the words that thou hast heard, with which the servants of the king of Asshur have reviled Me.
content_old: 6 and Isaiah saith unto them, ‘Thus do ye say unto your lord, Thus said Jehovah, Be not afraid because of the words that thou hast heard, with which the servants of the king of Asshur have reviled Me.

content: 7 Lo, I am giving in him a spirit, and he hath heard a report, and hath turned back unto his land, and I have caused him to fall by the sword in his land.’
content_old: 7 Lo, I am giving in him a spirit, and he hath heard a report, and hath turned back unto his land, and I have caused him to fall by the sword in his land.’

content: 8 And Rabshakeh turneth back and findeth the king of Asshur fighting against Libnah, for he hath heard that he hath journeyed from Lachish.
content_old: 8 And Rabshakeh turneth back and findeth the king of Asshur fighting against Libnah, for he hath heard that he hath journeyed from Lachish.

content: 9 And he heareth concerning Tirhakah king of Cush, saying, ‘He hath come out to fight with thee;’ and he heareth, and sendeth messengers unto Hezekiah, saying,
content_old: 9 And he heareth concerning Tirhakah king of Cush, saying, ‘He hath come out to fight with thee;’ and he heareth, and sendeth messengers unto Hezekiah, saying,

content: 10 ‘Thus do ye speak unto Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God lift thee up in whom thou art trusting, saying, Jerusalem is not given into the hand of the king of Asshur.
content_old: 10 ‘Thus do ye speak unto Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God lift thee up in whom thou art trusting, saying, Jerusalem is not given into the hand of the king of Asshur.

content: 11 Lo, thou hast heard that which the kings of Asshur have done to all the lands—to devote them—and thou art delivered!
content_old: 11 Lo, thou hast heard that which the kings of Asshur have done to all the lands—to devote them—and thou art delivered!

content: 12 Did the gods of the nations deliver them whom my fathers destroyed—Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the sons of Eden, who are in Telassar?
content_old: 12 Did the gods of the nations deliver them whom my fathers destroyed—Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the sons of Eden, who are in Telassar?

content: 13 Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?’
content_old: 13 Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?’

content: 14 And Hezekiah taketh the letters out of the hand of the messengers, and readeth them, and Hezekiah goeth up to the house of Jehovah, and Hezekiah spreadeth it before Jehovah.
content_old: 14 And Hezekiah taketh the letters out of the hand of the messengers, and readeth them, and Hezekiah goeth up to the house of Jehovah, and Hezekiah spreadeth it before Jehovah.

content: 15 And Hezekiah prayeth unto Jehovah, saying,
content_old: 15 And Hezekiah prayeth unto Jehovah, saying,

content: 16 ‘Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel, inhabiting the cherubs, Thou art God Himself—Thyself alone—to all kingdoms of the earth, Thou hast made the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 16 ‘Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel, inhabiting the cherubs, Thou art God Himself—Thyself alone—to all kingdoms of the earth, Thou hast made the heavens and the earth.

content: 17 Incline, O Jehovah, Thine ear, and hear; open, O Jehovah, Thine eyes and see; and hear Thou all the words of Sennacherib that he hath sent to reproach the living God.
content_old: 17 Incline, O Jehovah, Thine ear, and hear; open, O Jehovah, Thine eyes and see; and hear Thou all the words of Sennacherib that he hath sent to reproach the living God.

content: 18 ‘Truly, O Jehovah, kings of Asshur have laid waste all the lands and their land,
content_old: 18 ‘Truly, O Jehovah, kings of Asshur have laid waste all the lands and their land,

content: 19 so as to put their gods into fire—for they are no gods, but work of the hands of man, wood and stone—and they destroy them.
content_old: 19 so as to put their gods into fire—for they are no gods, but work of the hands of man, wood and stone—and they destroy them.

content: 20 And now, Jehovah our God, save us from his hand, and all kingdoms of the earth do know that Thou art Jehovah, Thyself alone.’
content_old: 20 And now, Jehovah our God, save us from his hand, and all kingdoms of the earth do know that Thou art Jehovah, Thyself alone.’

content: 21 And Isaiah son of Amoz sendeth unto Hezekiah, saying, ‘Thus said Jehovah, God of Israel, That which thou hast prayed unto me concerning Sennacherib king of Asshur—
content_old: 21 And Isaiah son of Amoz sendeth unto Hezekiah, saying, ‘Thus said Jehovah, God of Israel, That which thou hast prayed unto me concerning Sennacherib king of Asshur—

content: 22 this is the word that Jehovah spake concerning him: Trampled on thee, laughed at thee, Hath the virgin daughter of Zion, Behind thee shaken the head hath the daughter of Jerusalem.
content_old: 22 this is the word that Jehovah spake concerning him: Trampled on thee, laughed at thee, Hath the virgin daughter of Zion, Behind thee shaken the head hath the daughter of Jerusalem.

content: 23 Whom hast thou reproached and reviled? And against whom lifted up the voice? Yea, thou dost lift up on high thine eyes Against the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 23 Whom hast thou reproached and reviled? And against whom lifted up the voice? Yea, thou dost lift up on high thine eyes Against the Holy One of Israel.

content: 24 By the hand of thy servants Thou hast reviled the Lord, and sayest: In the multitude of my chariots I have come up to a high place of hills, The sides of Lebanon, And I cut down the height of its cedars, The choice of its firs, And I enter the high place of its extremity, The forest of its Carmel.
content_old: 24 By the hand of thy servants Thou hast reviled the Lord, and sayest: In the multitude of my chariots I have come up to a high place of hills, The sides of Lebanon, And I cut down the height of its cedars, The choice of its firs, And I enter the high place of its extremity, The forest of its Carmel.

content: 25 I—I have dug and drunk waters, And I dry up with the sole of my steps All floods of a bulwark.
content_old: 25 I—I have dug and drunk waters, And I dry up with the sole of my steps All floods of a bulwark.

content: 26 Hast thou not heard from afar?—it I did, From days of old—that I formed it. Now, I have brought it in, And it is to make desolate, Ruinous heaps—fenced cities,
content_old: 26 Hast thou not heard from afar?—it I did, From days of old—that I formed it. Now, I have brought it in, And it is to make desolate, Ruinous heaps—fenced cities,

content: 27 And their inhabitants are feeble-handed, They were broken down, and are dried up. They have been the herb of the field, And the greenness of the tender grass, Grass of the roofs, And blasted corn, before it hath risen up.
content_old: 27 And their inhabitants are feeble-handed, They were broken down, and are dried up. They have been the herb of the field, And the greenness of the tender grass, Grass of the roofs, And blasted corn, before it hath risen up.

content: 28 And thy sitting down, and thy going out, And thy coming in, I have known, And thy anger towards Me.
content_old: 28 And thy sitting down, and thy going out, And thy coming in, I have known, And thy anger towards Me.

content: 29 Because of thy anger towards Me, And thy noise—it came up into Mine ears, I have put My hook in thy nose, And My bridle in thy lips, And I have caused thee to turn back In the way in which thou camest.
content_old: 29 Because of thy anger towards Me, And thy noise—it came up into Mine ears, I have put My hook in thy nose, And My bridle in thy lips, And I have caused thee to turn back In the way in which thou camest.

content: 30 —And this to thee is the sign, Food of the year is self-sown grain, And in the second year the spontaneous growth, And in the third year, sow ye and reap, And plant vineyards, and eat their fruit.
content_old: 30 —And this to thee is the sign, Food of the year is self-sown grain, And in the second year the spontaneous growth, And in the third year, sow ye and reap, And plant vineyards, and eat their fruit.

content: 31 And it hath continued—the escaped Of the house of Judah that hath been left—To take root beneath, And it hath made fruit upward.
content_old: 31 And it hath continued—the escaped Of the house of Judah that hath been left—To take root beneath, And it hath made fruit upward.

content: 32 For from Jerusalem goeth forth a remnant, And an escape from mount Zion, The zeal of Jehovah of Hosts doth this.
content_old: 32 For from Jerusalem goeth forth a remnant, And an escape from mount Zion, The zeal of Jehovah of Hosts doth this.

content: 33 Therefore, thus said Jehovah, Concerning the king of Asshur: He doth not come in unto this city, Nor doth he shoot there an arrow, Nor doth he come before it with shield, Nor doth he pour out against it a mount.
content_old: 33 Therefore, thus said Jehovah, Concerning the king of Asshur: He doth not come in unto this city, Nor doth he shoot there an arrow, Nor doth he come before it with shield, Nor doth he pour out against it a mount.

content: 34 In the way that he came, in it he turneth back, And unto this city he doth not come in, An affirmation of Jehovah,
content_old: 34 In the way that he came, in it he turneth back, And unto this city he doth not come in, An affirmation of Jehovah,

content: 35 And I have covered over this city, To save it, for Mine own sake, And for the sake of David My servant.’
content_old: 35 And I have covered over this city, To save it, for Mine own sake, And for the sake of David My servant.’

content: 36 And a messenger of Jehovah goeth out, and smiteth in the camp of Asshur a hundred and eighty and five thousand; and men rise early in the morning, and lo, all of them are dead corpses.
content_old: 36 And a messenger of Jehovah goeth out, and smiteth in the camp of Asshur a hundred and eighty and five thousand; and men rise early in the morning, and lo, all of them are dead corpses.

content: 37 And journey, and go, and turn back doth Sennacherib king of Asshur, and dwelleth in Nineveh.
content_old: 37 And journey, and go, and turn back doth Sennacherib king of Asshur, and dwelleth in Nineveh.

content: 1 In those days hath Hezekiah been sick unto death, and come in unto him doth Isaiah son of Amoz, the prophet, and saith unto him, ‘Thus said Jehovah: Give a charge to thy house, for thou art dying, and dost not live.’
content_old: 1 In those days hath Hezekiah been sick unto death, and come in unto him doth Isaiah son of Amoz, the prophet, and saith unto him, ‘Thus said Jehovah: Give a charge to thy house, for thou art dying, and dost not live.’

content: 2 And Hezekiah turneth round his face unto the wall, and prayeth unto Jehovah,
content_old: 2 And Hezekiah turneth round his face unto the wall, and prayeth unto Jehovah,

content: 3 and saith, ‘I pray thee, O Jehovah, remember, I pray Thee, how I have walked habitually before Thee in truth, and with a perfect heart, and that which is good in thine eyes I have done;’ and Hezekiah weepeth—a great weeping.
content_old: 3 and saith, ‘I pray thee, O Jehovah, remember, I pray Thee, how I have walked habitually before Thee in truth, and with a perfect heart, and that which is good in thine eyes I have done;’ and Hezekiah weepeth—a great weeping.

content: 4 And a word of Jehovah is unto Isaiah, saying,
content_old: 4 And a word of Jehovah is unto Isaiah, saying,

content: 5 Go, and thou hast said to Hezekiah, Thus said Jehovah, God of David thy father, ‘I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tear, lo, I am adding to thy days fifteen years,
content_old: 5 Go, and thou hast said to Hezekiah, Thus said Jehovah, God of David thy father, ‘I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tear, lo, I am adding to thy days fifteen years,

content: 6 and out of the hand of the king of Asshur I deliver thee and this city, and have covered over this city.
content_old: 6 and out of the hand of the king of Asshur I deliver thee and this city, and have covered over this city.

content: 7 And this is to thee the sign from Jehovah, that Jehovah doth this thing that He hath spoken.
content_old: 7 And this is to thee the sign from Jehovah, that Jehovah doth this thing that He hath spoken.

content: 8 Lo, I am bringing back the shadow of the degrees that it hath gone down on the degrees of Ahaz, by the sun, backward ten degrees:’ and the sun turneth back ten degrees in the degrees that it had gone down.
content_old: 8 Lo, I am bringing back the shadow of the degrees that it hath gone down on the degrees of Ahaz, by the sun, backward ten degrees:’ and the sun turneth back ten degrees in the degrees that it had gone down.

content: 9 A writing of Hezekiah king of Judah concerning his being sick, when he reviveth from his sickness:
content_old: 9 A writing of Hezekiah king of Judah concerning his being sick, when he reviveth from his sickness:

content: 10 ‘I—I said in the cutting off of my days, I go in to the gates of Sheol, I have numbered the remnant of mine years.
content_old: 10 ‘I—I said in the cutting off of my days, I go in to the gates of Sheol, I have numbered the remnant of mine years.

content: 11 I said, I do not see Jah—Jah! In the land of the living, I do not behold man any more, With the inhabitants of the world.
content_old: 11 I said, I do not see Jah—Jah! In the land of the living, I do not behold man any more, With the inhabitants of the world.

content: 12 My sojourning hath departed, And been removed from me as a shepherd’s tent, I have drawn together, as a weaver, my life, By weakness it cutteth me off, From day unto night Thou dost end me.
content_old: 12 My sojourning hath departed, And been removed from me as a shepherd’s tent, I have drawn together, as a weaver, my life, By weakness it cutteth me off, From day unto night Thou dost end me.

content: 13 I have set Him till morning as a lion, So doth He break all my bones, From day unto night Thou dost end me.
content_old: 13 I have set Him till morning as a lion, So doth He break all my bones, From day unto night Thou dost end me.

content: 14 As a crane—a swallow—so I chatter, I mourn as a dove, Drawn up have been mine eyes on high, O Jehovah, oppression is on me, be my surety.
content_old: 14 As a crane—a swallow—so I chatter, I mourn as a dove, Drawn up have been mine eyes on high, O Jehovah, oppression is on me, be my surety.

content: 15 —What do I say? seeing He said to me, And He Himself hath wrought, I go softly all my years for the bitterness of my soul.
content_old: 15 —What do I say? seeing He said to me, And He Himself hath wrought, I go softly all my years for the bitterness of my soul.

content: 16 Lord, by these do men live, And by all in them is the life of my spirit, And Thou savest me, make me also to live,
content_old: 16 Lord, by these do men live, And by all in them is the life of my spirit, And Thou savest me, make me also to live,

content: 17 Lo, to peace He changed for me bitterness, And Thou hast delighted in my soul without corruption, For Thou hast cast behind Thy back all my sins.
content_old: 17 Lo, to peace He changed for me bitterness, And Thou hast delighted in my soul without corruption, For Thou hast cast behind Thy back all my sins.

content: 18 For Sheol doth not confess Thee, Death doth not praise Thee, Those going down to the pit hope not for Thy truth.
content_old: 18 For Sheol doth not confess Thee, Death doth not praise Thee, Those going down to the pit hope not for Thy truth.

content: 19 The living, the living, he doth confess Thee.
content_old: 19 The living, the living, he doth confess Thee.

content: 20 Like myself to-day—a father to sons Doth make known of Thy faithfulness, O Jehovah—to save me: And my songs we sing all days of our lives In the house of Jehovah.’
content_old: 20 Like myself to-day—a father to sons Doth make known of Thy faithfulness, O Jehovah—to save me: And my songs we sing all days of our lives In the house of Jehovah.’

content: 21 And Isaiah saith, ‘Let them take a bunch of figs, and plaster over the ulcer, and he liveth.’
content_old: 21 And Isaiah saith, ‘Let them take a bunch of figs, and plaster over the ulcer, and he liveth.’

content: 1 At that time hath Merodach-Baladan, son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah, when he heareth that he hath been sick, and is become strong.
content_old: 1 At that time hath Merodach-Baladan, son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah, when he heareth that he hath been sick, and is become strong.

content: 2 And Hezekiah rejoiceth over them, and sheweth them the house of his spices, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the good ointment, and all the house of his vessels, and all that hath been found in his treasures; there hath not been a thing in his house, and in all his dominion, that Hezekiah hath not shewed them.
content_old: 2 And Hezekiah rejoiceth over them, and sheweth them the house of his spices, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the good ointment, and all the house of his vessels, and all that hath been found in his treasures; there hath not been a thing in his house, and in all his dominion, that Hezekiah hath not shewed them.

content: 3 And Isaiah the prophet cometh in unto king Hezekiah, and saith unto him, ‘What said these men? and whence come they unto thee?’ And Hezekiah saith, ‘From a land afar off they have come unto me—from Babylon.’
content_old: 3 And Isaiah the prophet cometh in unto king Hezekiah, and saith unto him, ‘What said these men? and whence come they unto thee?’ And Hezekiah saith, ‘From a land afar off they have come unto me—from Babylon.’

content: 4 And he saith, ‘What saw they in thy house?’ and Hezekiah saith, ‘All that is in my house they saw; there hath not been a thing that I have not shewed them among my treasures.’
content_old: 4 And he saith, ‘What saw they in thy house?’ and Hezekiah saith, ‘All that is in my house they saw; there hath not been a thing that I have not shewed them among my treasures.’

content: 5 And Isaiah saith unto Hezekiah, ‘Hear a word of Jehovah of Hosts:
content_old: 5 And Isaiah saith unto Hezekiah, ‘Hear a word of Jehovah of Hosts:

content: 6 Lo, days are coming, and borne hath been all that is in thy house, and that thy fathers have treasured up till this day, to Babylon; there is not left a thing, said Jehovah;
content_old: 6 Lo, days are coming, and borne hath been all that is in thy house, and that thy fathers have treasured up till this day, to Babylon; there is not left a thing, said Jehovah;

content: 7 and of thy sons who come forth from thee, whom thou begettest, they take, and they have been eunuchs in a palace of the king of Babylon.’
content_old: 7 and of thy sons who come forth from thee, whom thou begettest, they take, and they have been eunuchs in a palace of the king of Babylon.’

content: 1 Comfort ye, comfort ye, My people, saith your God.
content_old: 1 Comfort ye, comfort ye, My people, saith your God.

content: 2 Speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and call to her, That her warfare hath been completed, That accepted hath been her punishment, That she hath received from the hand of Jehovah Double for all her sins.
content_old: 2 Speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and call to her, That her warfare hath been completed, That accepted hath been her punishment, That she hath received from the hand of Jehovah Double for all her sins.

content: 3 A voice is crying—in a wilderness—Prepare ye the way of Jehovah, Make straight in a desert a highway to our God.
content_old: 3 A voice is crying—in a wilderness—Prepare ye the way of Jehovah, Make straight in a desert a highway to our God.

content: 4 Every valley is raised up, And every mountain and hill become low, And the crooked place hath become a plain, And the entangled places a valley.
content_old: 4 Every valley is raised up, And every mountain and hill become low, And the crooked place hath become a plain, And the entangled places a valley.

content: 5 And revealed hath been the honour of Jehovah, And seen it have all flesh together, For the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken.
content_old: 5 And revealed hath been the honour of Jehovah, And seen it have all flesh together, For the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken.

content: 6 A voice is saying, ‘Call,’ And he said, ‘What do I call?’ All flesh is grass, and all its goodliness is As a flower of the field:
content_old: 6 A voice is saying, ‘Call,’ And he said, ‘What do I call?’ All flesh is grass, and all its goodliness is As a flower of the field:

content: 7 Withered hath grass, faded the flower, For the Spirit of Jehovah blew upon it, Surely the people is grass;
content_old: 7 Withered hath grass, faded the flower, For the Spirit of Jehovah blew upon it, Surely the people is grass;

content: 8 Withered hath grass, faded the flower, But a word of our God riseth for ever.
content_old: 8 Withered hath grass, faded the flower, But a word of our God riseth for ever.

content: 9 On a high mountain get thee up, O Zion, Proclaiming tidings, Lift up with power thy voice, O Jerusalem, proclaiming tidings, Lift up, fear not, say to cities of Judah, ‘Lo, your God.’
content_old: 9 On a high mountain get thee up, O Zion, Proclaiming tidings, Lift up with power thy voice, O Jerusalem, proclaiming tidings, Lift up, fear not, say to cities of Judah, ‘Lo, your God.’

content: 10 Lo, the Lord Jehovah with strength cometh, And His arm is ruling for Him, Lo, His hire is with Him, and His wage before Him.
content_old: 10 Lo, the Lord Jehovah with strength cometh, And His arm is ruling for Him, Lo, His hire is with Him, and His wage before Him.

content: 11 As a shepherd His flock He feedeth, With His arm He gathereth lambs, And in His bosom He carrieth them: Suckling ones He leadeth.
content_old: 11 As a shepherd His flock He feedeth, With His arm He gathereth lambs, And in His bosom He carrieth them: Suckling ones He leadeth.

content: 12 Who hath measured in the hollow of his hand the waters? And the heavens by a span hath meted out, And comprehended in a measure the dust of the earth, And hath weighed in scales the mountains, And the hills in a balance?
content_old: 12 Who hath measured in the hollow of his hand the waters? And the heavens by a span hath meted out, And comprehended in a measure the dust of the earth, And hath weighed in scales the mountains, And the hills in a balance?

content: 13 Who hath meted out the Spirit of Jehovah, And, being His counsellor, doth teach Him!
content_old: 13 Who hath meted out the Spirit of Jehovah, And, being His counsellor, doth teach Him!

content: 14 With whom consulted He, That he causeth Him to understand? And teacheth Him in the path of judgment, And teacheth Him knowledge? And the way of understanding causeth Him to know?
content_old: 14 With whom consulted He, That he causeth Him to understand? And teacheth Him in the path of judgment, And teacheth Him knowledge? And the way of understanding causeth Him to know?

content: 15 Lo, nations as a drop from a bucket, And as small dust of the balance, have been reckoned, Lo, isles as a small thing He taketh up.
content_old: 15 Lo, nations as a drop from a bucket, And as small dust of the balance, have been reckoned, Lo, isles as a small thing He taketh up.

content: 16 And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, Nor its beasts sufficient for a burnt-offering.
content_old: 16 And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, Nor its beasts sufficient for a burnt-offering.

content: 17 All the nations are as nothing before Him, Less than nothing and emptiness, They have been reckoned to Him.
content_old: 17 All the nations are as nothing before Him, Less than nothing and emptiness, They have been reckoned to Him.

content: 18 And unto whom do ye liken God, And what likeness do ye compare to Him?
content_old: 18 And unto whom do ye liken God, And what likeness do ye compare to Him?

content: 19 The graven image poured out hath a artisan, And a refiner with gold spreadeth it over, And chains of silver he is refining.
content_old: 19 The graven image poured out hath a artisan, And a refiner with gold spreadeth it over, And chains of silver he is refining.

content: 20 He who is poor by heave-offerings, A tree not rotten doth choose, A skilful artisan he seeketh for it, To establish a graven image—not moved.
content_old: 20 He who is poor by heave-offerings, A tree not rotten doth choose, A skilful artisan he seeketh for it, To establish a graven image—not moved.

content: 21 Do ye not know—do ye not hear? Hath it not been declared from the first to you? Have ye not understood From the foundations of the earth?
content_old: 21 Do ye not know—do ye not hear? Hath it not been declared from the first to you? Have ye not understood From the foundations of the earth?

content: 22 He who is sitting on the circle of the earth, And its inhabitants are as grasshoppers, He who is stretching out as a thin thing the heavens, And spreadeth them as a tent to dwell in.
content_old: 22 He who is sitting on the circle of the earth, And its inhabitants are as grasshoppers, He who is stretching out as a thin thing the heavens, And spreadeth them as a tent to dwell in.

content: 23 He who is making princes become nothing, Judges of earth as emptiness hath made;
content_old: 23 He who is making princes become nothing, Judges of earth as emptiness hath made;

content: 24 Yea, they have not been planted, Yea, they have not been sown, Yea, not taking root in the earth is their stock, And also He hath blown upon them, and they wither, And a whirlwind as stubble taketh them away.
content_old: 24 Yea, they have not been planted, Yea, they have not been sown, Yea, not taking root in the earth is their stock, And also He hath blown upon them, and they wither, And a whirlwind as stubble taketh them away.

content: 25 And unto whom do ye liken Me, And am I equal? saith the Holy One.
content_old: 25 And unto whom do ye liken Me, And am I equal? saith the Holy One.

content: 26 Lift up on high your eyes, And see—who hath prepared these? He who is bringing out by number their host, To all of them by name He calleth, By abundance of strength (And he is strong in power) not one is lacking.
content_old: 26 Lift up on high your eyes, And see—who hath prepared these? He who is bringing out by number their host, To all of them by name He calleth, By abundance of strength (And he is strong in power) not one is lacking.

content: 27 Why sayest thou, O Jacob? and speakest thou, O Israel? ‘My way hath been hid from Jehovah, And from my God my judgment passeth over.’
content_old: 27 Why sayest thou, O Jacob? and speakest thou, O Israel? ‘My way hath been hid from Jehovah, And from my God my judgment passeth over.’

content: 28 Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard? The God of the age—Jehovah, Preparer of the ends of the earth, Is not wearied nor fatigued, There is no searching of His understanding.
content_old: 28 Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard? The God of the age—Jehovah, Preparer of the ends of the earth, Is not wearied nor fatigued, There is no searching of His understanding.

content: 29 He is giving power to the weary, And to those not strong He increaseth might.
content_old: 29 He is giving power to the weary, And to those not strong He increaseth might.

content: 30 Even youths are wearied and fatigued, And young men utterly stumble,
content_old: 30 Even youths are wearied and fatigued, And young men utterly stumble,

content: 1 Keep silent towards Me, O isles, And the peoples pass on to power, They come nigh, then they speak, ‘Together—to judgment we draw near.’
content_old: 1 Keep silent towards Me, O isles, And the peoples pass on to power, They come nigh, then they speak, ‘Together—to judgment we draw near.’

content: 2 Who stirred up from the east a righteous one? He calleth him to His foot, He giveth before him nations, And kings He causeth him to rule, He giveth them as dust to his sword, As driven stubble to his bow.
content_old: 2 Who stirred up from the east a righteous one? He calleth him to His foot, He giveth before him nations, And kings He causeth him to rule, He giveth them as dust to his sword, As driven stubble to his bow.

content: 3 He pursueth them, he passeth over in safety A path with his feet he entereth not.
content_old: 3 He pursueth them, he passeth over in safety A path with his feet he entereth not.

content: 4 Who hath wrought and done, Calling the generations from the first? I, Jehovah, the first, and with the last I am He.
content_old: 4 Who hath wrought and done, Calling the generations from the first? I, Jehovah, the first, and with the last I am He.

content: 5 Seen have isles and fear, ends of the earth tremble, They have drawn near, yea, they come.
content_old: 5 Seen have isles and fear, ends of the earth tremble, They have drawn near, yea, they come.

content: 6 Each his neighbour they help, And to his brother he saith, ‘Be strong.’
content_old: 6 Each his neighbour they help, And to his brother he saith, ‘Be strong.’

content: 7 And strengthen doth an artisan the refiner, A smoother with a hammer, Him who is beating on an anvil, Saying, ‘For joining it is good,’ And he strengtheneth it with nails, it is not moved!
content_old: 7 And strengthen doth an artisan the refiner, A smoother with a hammer, Him who is beating on an anvil, Saying, ‘For joining it is good,’ And he strengtheneth it with nails, it is not moved!

content: 8 —And thou, O Israel, My servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, Seed of Abraham, My lover,
content_old: 8 —And thou, O Israel, My servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, Seed of Abraham, My lover,

content: 9 Whom I have taken hold of, from the ends of the earth, And from its near places I have called thee, And I say to thee, My servant Thou art, I have chosen thee, and not rejected thee.
content_old: 9 Whom I have taken hold of, from the ends of the earth, And from its near places I have called thee, And I say to thee, My servant Thou art, I have chosen thee, and not rejected thee.

content: 10 Be not afraid, for with thee I am, Look not around, for I am thy God, I have strengthened thee, Yea, I have helped thee, yea, I upheld thee, With the right hand of My righteousness.
content_old: 10 Be not afraid, for with thee I am, Look not around, for I am thy God, I have strengthened thee, Yea, I have helped thee, yea, I upheld thee, With the right hand of My righteousness.

content: 11 Lo, all those displeased with thee, They are ashamed and blush, They are as nothing, yea, perish Do the men who strive with thee.
content_old: 11 Lo, all those displeased with thee, They are ashamed and blush, They are as nothing, yea, perish Do the men who strive with thee.

content: 12 Thou seekest them, and findest them not, The men who debate with thee, They are as nothing, yea, as nothing, The men who war with thee.
content_old: 12 Thou seekest them, and findest them not, The men who debate with thee, They are as nothing, yea, as nothing, The men who war with thee.

content: 13 For I, Jehovah thy God, Am strengthening thy right hand, He who is saying to thee, ‘Fear not, I have helped thee.’
content_old: 13 For I, Jehovah thy God, Am strengthening thy right hand, He who is saying to thee, ‘Fear not, I have helped thee.’

content: 14 Fear not, O worm Jacob, ye men of Israel, I helped thee, an affirmation of Jehovah, Even thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 14 Fear not, O worm Jacob, ye men of Israel, I helped thee, an affirmation of Jehovah, Even thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

content: 15 Lo, I have set thee for a new sharp threshing instrument, Possessing teeth, thou threshest mountains, And beatest small, and hills as chaff thou makest.
content_old: 15 Lo, I have set thee for a new sharp threshing instrument, Possessing teeth, thou threshest mountains, And beatest small, and hills as chaff thou makest.

content: 16 Thou winnowest them, and a wind lifteth them up, And a whirlwind scattereth them, And thou—thou rejoicest in Jehovah, In the Holy One of Israel dost boast thyself.
content_old: 16 Thou winnowest them, and a wind lifteth them up, And a whirlwind scattereth them, And thou—thou rejoicest in Jehovah, In the Holy One of Israel dost boast thyself.

content: 17 The poor and the needy are seeking water, And there is none, Their tongue with thirst hath failed, I, Jehovah do answer them, The God of Israel—I forsake them not.
content_old: 17 The poor and the needy are seeking water, And there is none, Their tongue with thirst hath failed, I, Jehovah do answer them, The God of Israel—I forsake them not.

content: 18 I open on high places rivers, And in midst of valleys fountains, I make a wilderness become a pond of water, And a dry land become springs of water.
content_old: 18 I open on high places rivers, And in midst of valleys fountains, I make a wilderness become a pond of water, And a dry land become springs of water.

content: 19 I give in a wilderness the cedar, Shittah, and myrtle, and oil-tree, I set in a desert the fir-pine and box-wood together.
content_old: 19 I give in a wilderness the cedar, Shittah, and myrtle, and oil-tree, I set in a desert the fir-pine and box-wood together.

content: 20 So that they see, and know, And regard, and act wisely together, For the hand of Jehovah hath done this, And the Holy One of Israel hath prepared it.
content_old: 20 So that they see, and know, And regard, and act wisely together, For the hand of Jehovah hath done this, And the Holy One of Israel hath prepared it.

content: 21 Bring near your cause, saith Jehovah, Bring nigh your mighty ones, saith the king of Jacob.
content_old: 21 Bring near your cause, saith Jehovah, Bring nigh your mighty ones, saith the king of Jacob.

content: 22 They bring nigh, and declare to us that which doth happen, The first things—what they are declare ye, And we set our heart, and know their latter end, Or the coming things cause us to hear.
content_old: 22 They bring nigh, and declare to us that which doth happen, The first things—what they are declare ye, And we set our heart, and know their latter end, Or the coming things cause us to hear.

content: 23 Declare the things that are coming hereafter, And we know that ye are gods, Yea, ye may do good or do evil, And we look around and see it together.
content_old: 23 Declare the things that are coming hereafter, And we know that ye are gods, Yea, ye may do good or do evil, And we look around and see it together.

content: 24 Lo, ye are of nothing, and your work of nought, An abomination—it fixeth on you.
content_old: 24 Lo, ye are of nothing, and your work of nought, An abomination—it fixeth on you.

content: 25 I have stirred up one from the north, And he cometh, From the rising of the sun he calleth in My name, And he cometh in on prefects as on clay, And as a potter treadeth down mire.
content_old: 25 I have stirred up one from the north, And he cometh, From the rising of the sun he calleth in My name, And he cometh in on prefects as on clay, And as a potter treadeth down mire.

content: 26 Who hath declared from the first, and we know? And beforetime, and we say, ‘Righteous?’ yea, there is none declaring, Yea, there is none proclaiming, Yea, there is none hearing your sayings.
content_old: 26 Who hath declared from the first, and we know? And beforetime, and we say, ‘Righteous?’ yea, there is none declaring, Yea, there is none proclaiming, Yea, there is none hearing your sayings.

content: 27 First to Zion, Behold, behold them, And to Jerusalem one proclaiming tidings I give,
content_old: 27 First to Zion, Behold, behold them, And to Jerusalem one proclaiming tidings I give,

content: 28 And I see that there is no man, Yea, of these that there is no counsellor, And I ask them, and they return word:
content_old: 28 And I see that there is no man, Yea, of these that there is no counsellor, And I ask them, and they return word:

content: 1 Lo, My servant, I take hold on him, My chosen one—My soul hath accepted, I have put My Spirit upon him, Judgment to nations he bringeth forth.
content_old: 1 Lo, My servant, I take hold on him, My chosen one—My soul hath accepted, I have put My Spirit upon him, Judgment to nations he bringeth forth.

content: 2 He doth not cry, nor lift up, Nor cause his voice to be heard, in the street.
content_old: 2 He doth not cry, nor lift up, Nor cause his voice to be heard, in the street.

content: 3 A bruised reed he breaketh not, And dim flax he quencheth not, To truth he bringeth forth judgment.
content_old: 3 A bruised reed he breaketh not, And dim flax he quencheth not, To truth he bringeth forth judgment.

content: 4 He doth not become weak nor bruised, Till he setteth judgment in the earth, And for his law isles wait with hope.
content_old: 4 He doth not become weak nor bruised, Till he setteth judgment in the earth, And for his law isles wait with hope.

content: 5 Thus said God, Jehovah, preparing The heavens, and stretching them out, Spreading out the earth and its productions, Giving breath to the people on it, And spirit to those walking in it.
content_old: 5 Thus said God, Jehovah, preparing The heavens, and stretching them out, Spreading out the earth and its productions, Giving breath to the people on it, And spirit to those walking in it.

content: 6 I, Jehovah, did call thee in righteousness, And I lay hold on thy hand, and keep thee, And I give thee for a covenant of a people, And a light of nations.
content_old: 6 I, Jehovah, did call thee in righteousness, And I lay hold on thy hand, and keep thee, And I give thee for a covenant of a people, And a light of nations.

content: 7 To open the eyes of the blind, To bring forth from prison the bound one, From the house of restraint those sitting in darkness.
content_old: 7 To open the eyes of the blind, To bring forth from prison the bound one, From the house of restraint those sitting in darkness.

content: 8 I am Jehovah, this is My name, And Mine honour to another I give not, Nor My praise to graven images.
content_old: 8 I am Jehovah, this is My name, And Mine honour to another I give not, Nor My praise to graven images.

content: 9 The former things, lo, have come, And new things I am declaring, Before they spring up I cause you to hear.
content_old: 9 The former things, lo, have come, And new things I am declaring, Before they spring up I cause you to hear.

content: 10 Sing to Jehovah a new song, His praise from the end of the earth, Ye who are going down to the sea, and its fulness, Isles, and their inhabitants.
content_old: 10 Sing to Jehovah a new song, His praise from the end of the earth, Ye who are going down to the sea, and its fulness, Isles, and their inhabitants.

content: 11 The wilderness and its cities do lift up the voice, The villages Kedar doth inhabit, Sing do the inhabitants of Sela, From the top of mountains they cry.
content_old: 11 The wilderness and its cities do lift up the voice, The villages Kedar doth inhabit, Sing do the inhabitants of Sela, From the top of mountains they cry.

content: 12 They ascribe to Jehovah honour, And His praise in the isles they declare.
content_old: 12 They ascribe to Jehovah honour, And His praise in the isles they declare.

content: 13 Jehovah as a mighty one goeth forth. As a man of war He stirreth up zeal, He crieth, yea, He shrieketh, Against His enemies He showeth Himself mighty.
content_old: 13 Jehovah as a mighty one goeth forth. As a man of war He stirreth up zeal, He crieth, yea, He shrieketh, Against His enemies He showeth Himself mighty.

content: 14 I have kept silent from of old, I keep silent, I refrain myself, As a travailing woman I cry out, I desolate and swallow up together.
content_old: 14 I have kept silent from of old, I keep silent, I refrain myself, As a travailing woman I cry out, I desolate and swallow up together.

content: 15 I make waste mountains and hills, And all their herbs I dry up, And I have made rivers become isles, And ponds I dry up.
content_old: 15 I make waste mountains and hills, And all their herbs I dry up, And I have made rivers become isles, And ponds I dry up.

content: 16 And I have caused the blind to go, In a way they have not known, In paths they have not known I cause them to tread, I make a dark place before them become light, And unlevelled places become a plain, These are the things I have done to them, And I have not forsaken them.
content_old: 16 And I have caused the blind to go, In a way they have not known, In paths they have not known I cause them to tread, I make a dark place before them become light, And unlevelled places become a plain, These are the things I have done to them, And I have not forsaken them.

content: 17 Removed backward—utterly ashamed, Are those trusting in a graven image, Those saying to a molten image, ‘Ye are our gods.’
content_old: 17 Removed backward—utterly ashamed, Are those trusting in a graven image, Those saying to a molten image, ‘Ye are our gods.’

content: 18 Ye deaf, hear; and ye blind, look to see.
content_old: 18 Ye deaf, hear; and ye blind, look to see.

content: 19 Who is blind but My servant? And deaf as My messenger I send? Who is blind as he who is at peace, Yea, blind, as the servant of Jehovah?
content_old: 19 Who is blind but My servant? And deaf as My messenger I send? Who is blind as he who is at peace, Yea, blind, as the servant of Jehovah?

content: 20 Seeing many things, and thou observest not, Opening ears, and he heareth not.
content_old: 20 Seeing many things, and thou observest not, Opening ears, and he heareth not.

content: 21 Jehovah hath delight for the sake of His righteousness, He magnifieth law, and maketh honourable.
content_old: 21 Jehovah hath delight for the sake of His righteousness, He magnifieth law, and maketh honourable.

content: 22 And this is a people seized and spoiled, Snared in holes—all of them, And in houses of restraint they were hidden, They have been for a prey, And there is no deliverer, A spoil, and none is saying, ‘Restore.’
content_old: 22 And this is a people seized and spoiled, Snared in holes—all of them, And in houses of restraint they were hidden, They have been for a prey, And there is no deliverer, A spoil, and none is saying, ‘Restore.’

content: 23 Who among you giveth ear to this? Attendeth, and heareth afterwards.
content_old: 23 Who among you giveth ear to this? Attendeth, and heareth afterwards.

content: 24 Who hath given Jacob for a spoil, And Israel to the spoilers? Is it not Jehovah—He against whom we sinned? Yea, they have not been willing in His ways to walk, Nor have they hearkened to His law.
content_old: 24 Who hath given Jacob for a spoil, And Israel to the spoilers? Is it not Jehovah—He against whom we sinned? Yea, they have not been willing in His ways to walk, Nor have they hearkened to His law.

content: 1 And now, thus said Jehovah, Thy Creator, O Jacob, and thy Fashioner, O Israel, Be not afraid, for I have redeemed thee, I have called on thy name—thou art Mine.
content_old: 1 And now, thus said Jehovah, Thy Creator, O Jacob, and thy Fashioner, O Israel, Be not afraid, for I have redeemed thee, I have called on thy name—thou art Mine.

content: 2 When thou passest into waters, I am with thee, And into floods, they do not overflow thee, When thou goest into fire, thou art not burnt, And a flame doth not burn against thee.
content_old: 2 When thou passest into waters, I am with thee, And into floods, they do not overflow thee, When thou goest into fire, thou art not burnt, And a flame doth not burn against thee.

content: 3 For I—Jehovah thy God, The Holy One of Israel, thy Saviour, I have appointed Egypt thine atonement, Cush and Seba in thy stead.
content_old: 3 For I—Jehovah thy God, The Holy One of Israel, thy Saviour, I have appointed Egypt thine atonement, Cush and Seba in thy stead.

content: 4 Since thou wast precious in Mine eyes, Thou wast honoured, and I have loved thee, And I appoint men in thy stead, And peoples instead of thy life.
content_old: 4 Since thou wast precious in Mine eyes, Thou wast honoured, and I have loved thee, And I appoint men in thy stead, And peoples instead of thy life.

content: 5 Be not afraid, for I am with thee, From the east I bring in thy seed, And from the west I gather thee.
content_old: 5 Be not afraid, for I am with thee, From the east I bring in thy seed, And from the west I gather thee.

content: 6 I am saying to the north, ‘Give up,’ And to the south, ‘Restrain not.’ Bring in My sons from afar, And My daughters from the end of the earth.
content_old: 6 I am saying to the north, ‘Give up,’ And to the south, ‘Restrain not.’ Bring in My sons from afar, And My daughters from the end of the earth.

content: 7 Every one who is called by My name, Even for My honour I have created him, I have formed him, yea, I have made him.
content_old: 7 Every one who is called by My name, Even for My honour I have created him, I have formed him, yea, I have made him.

content: 8 He brought out a blind people who have eyes, And deaf ones who have ears.
content_old: 8 He brought out a blind people who have eyes, And deaf ones who have ears.

content: 9 All the nations have been gathered together, And the peoples are assembled, Who among them declareth this, And former things causeth us to hear? They give their witnesses, And they are declared righteous, And they hear and say, ‘Truth.’
content_old: 9 All the nations have been gathered together, And the peoples are assembled, Who among them declareth this, And former things causeth us to hear? They give their witnesses, And they are declared righteous, And they hear and say, ‘Truth.’

content: 10 Ye are My witnesses, an affirmation of Jehovah, And My servant whom I have chosen, So that ye know and give credence to Me, And understand that I am He, Before Me there was no God formed, And after Me there is none.
content_old: 10 Ye are My witnesses, an affirmation of Jehovah, And My servant whom I have chosen, So that ye know and give credence to Me, And understand that I am He, Before Me there was no God formed, And after Me there is none.

content: 11 I—I am Jehovah, And besides Me there is no saviour.
content_old: 11 I—I am Jehovah, And besides Me there is no saviour.

content: 12 I—I declared, and saved, and proclaimed, And there is no stranger with you, And ye are My witnesses, an affirmation of Jehovah, And I am God.
content_old: 12 I—I declared, and saved, and proclaimed, And there is no stranger with you, And ye are My witnesses, an affirmation of Jehovah, And I am God.

content: 13 Even from the day I am He, And there is no deliverer from My hand, I work, and who doth turn it back?
content_old: 13 Even from the day I am He, And there is no deliverer from My hand, I work, and who doth turn it back?

content: 14 Thus said Jehovah, your Redeemer, The Holy One of Israel: ‘For your sake I have sent to Babylon, And caused bars to descend—all of them, And the Chaldeans, whose song is in the ships.
content_old: 14 Thus said Jehovah, your Redeemer, The Holy One of Israel: ‘For your sake I have sent to Babylon, And caused bars to descend—all of them, And the Chaldeans, whose song is in the ships.

content: 15 I am Jehovah, your Holy One, Creator of Israel, your King.’
content_old: 15 I am Jehovah, your Holy One, Creator of Israel, your King.’

content: 16 Thus said Jehovah, Who is giving in the sea a way, And in the strong waters a path.
content_old: 16 Thus said Jehovah, Who is giving in the sea a way, And in the strong waters a path.

content: 17 Who is bringing forth chariot and horse, A force, even a strong one: ‘Together they lie down—they rise not, They have been extinguished, As flax they have been quenched.’
content_old: 17 Who is bringing forth chariot and horse, A force, even a strong one: ‘Together they lie down—they rise not, They have been extinguished, As flax they have been quenched.’

content: 18 Remember not former things, And ancient things consider not.
content_old: 18 Remember not former things, And ancient things consider not.

content: 19 Lo, I am doing a new thing, now it springeth up, Do ye not know it? Yea, I put in a wilderness a way, In a desolate place—floods.
content_old: 19 Lo, I am doing a new thing, now it springeth up, Do ye not know it? Yea, I put in a wilderness a way, In a desolate place—floods.

content: 20 Honour me doth the beast of the field, Dragons and daughters of an ostrich, For I have given in a wilderness waters, Floods in a desolate place, To give drink to My people—My chosen.
content_old: 20 Honour me doth the beast of the field, Dragons and daughters of an ostrich, For I have given in a wilderness waters, Floods in a desolate place, To give drink to My people—My chosen.

content: 21 This people I have formed for Myself, My praise they recount.
content_old: 21 This people I have formed for Myself, My praise they recount.

content: 22 And Me thou hast not called, O Jacob, For thou hast been wearied of me, O Israel,
content_old: 22 And Me thou hast not called, O Jacob, For thou hast been wearied of me, O Israel,

content: 23 Thou hast not brought in to Me, The lamb of thy burnt-offerings, And with thy sacrifices thou hast not honoured Me, I have not caused thee to serve with a present, Nor wearied thee with frankincense.
content_old: 23 Thou hast not brought in to Me, The lamb of thy burnt-offerings, And with thy sacrifices thou hast not honoured Me, I have not caused thee to serve with a present, Nor wearied thee with frankincense.

content: 24 Thou hast not bought for Me with money sweet cane, And with the fat of thy sacrifices hast not filled Me, Only—thou hast caused Me to serve with thy sins, Thou hast wearied Me with thine iniquities.
content_old: 24 Thou hast not bought for Me with money sweet cane, And with the fat of thy sacrifices hast not filled Me, Only—thou hast caused Me to serve with thy sins, Thou hast wearied Me with thine iniquities.

content: 25 I—I am He who is blotting out Thy transgressions for Mine own sake, And thy sins I do not remember.
content_old: 25 I—I am He who is blotting out Thy transgressions for Mine own sake, And thy sins I do not remember.

content: 26 Cause me to remember—we are judged together, Declare thou that thou mayest be justified.
content_old: 26 Cause me to remember—we are judged together, Declare thou that thou mayest be justified.

content: 27 Thy first father sinned, And thine interpreters transgressed against me,
content_old: 27 Thy first father sinned, And thine interpreters transgressed against me,

content: 1 And now, hear, O Jacob, My servant, And Israel, whom I have fixed on:
content_old: 1 And now, hear, O Jacob, My servant, And Israel, whom I have fixed on:

content: 2 Thus said Jehovah, thy Maker, and thy Former, From the womb He doth help thee; Fear not, my servant Jacob, And Jeshurun, whom I have fixed on.
content_old: 2 Thus said Jehovah, thy Maker, and thy Former, From the womb He doth help thee; Fear not, my servant Jacob, And Jeshurun, whom I have fixed on.

content: 3 For I pour waters on a thirsty one, And floods on a dry land, I pour My Spirit on thy seed, And My blessing on thine offspring.
content_old: 3 For I pour waters on a thirsty one, And floods on a dry land, I pour My Spirit on thy seed, And My blessing on thine offspring.

content: 4 And they have sprung up as among grass, As willows by streams of water.
content_old: 4 And they have sprung up as among grass, As willows by streams of water.

content: 5 This one saith, For Jehovah I am, And this calleth himself by the name of Jacob, And this one writeth with his hand, ‘For Jehovah,’ and by the name of Israel surnameth himself.
content_old: 5 This one saith, For Jehovah I am, And this calleth himself by the name of Jacob, And this one writeth with his hand, ‘For Jehovah,’ and by the name of Israel surnameth himself.

content: 6 Thus said Jehovah, king of Israel, And his Redeemer, Jehovah of Hosts: ‘I am the first, and I the last, And besides Me there is no God.
content_old: 6 Thus said Jehovah, king of Israel, And his Redeemer, Jehovah of Hosts: ‘I am the first, and I the last, And besides Me there is no God.

content: 7 And who as I, doth call and declare it, And arrange it for Me, Since My placing the people of antiquity, And things that are coming, And those that do come, declare they to them?
content_old: 7 And who as I, doth call and declare it, And arrange it for Me, Since My placing the people of antiquity, And things that are coming, And those that do come, declare they to them?

content: 8 Fear not, nor be afraid, Have I not from that time caused thee to hear, and declared? And ye are My witnesses, Is there a God besides Me? yea, there is none, A Rock I have not known.
content_old: 8 Fear not, nor be afraid, Have I not from that time caused thee to hear, and declared? And ye are My witnesses, Is there a God besides Me? yea, there is none, A Rock I have not known.

content: 9 Framers of a graven image are all of them emptiness, And their desirable things do not profit, And their own witnesses they are, They see not, nor know, that they may be ashamed.
content_old: 9 Framers of a graven image are all of them emptiness, And their desirable things do not profit, And their own witnesses they are, They see not, nor know, that they may be ashamed.

content: 10 Who hath formed a god, And a molten image poured out—not profitable?
content_old: 10 Who hath formed a god, And a molten image poured out—not profitable?

content: 11 Lo, all his companions are ashamed, As to artisans—they are of men, All of them gather together, they stand up, They fear, they are ashamed together.
content_old: 11 Lo, all his companions are ashamed, As to artisans—they are of men, All of them gather together, they stand up, They fear, they are ashamed together.

content: 12 He hath wrought iron with an axe, And hath wrought with coals, And with hammers doth form it, And doth work it by his powerful arm, Yea, he is hungry, and there is no power, He doth not drink water, and he is wearied.
content_old: 12 He hath wrought iron with an axe, And hath wrought with coals, And with hammers doth form it, And doth work it by his powerful arm, Yea, he is hungry, and there is no power, He doth not drink water, and he is wearied.

content: 13 He hath wrought with wood, He hath stretched out a rule, He doth mark it out with a line, He maketh it with carving tools, And with a compass he marketh it out, And maketh it according to the form of a man, According to the beauty of a man, To remain in the house.
content_old: 13 He hath wrought with wood, He hath stretched out a rule, He doth mark it out with a line, He maketh it with carving tools, And with a compass he marketh it out, And maketh it according to the form of a man, According to the beauty of a man, To remain in the house.

content: 14 Cutting down to himself cedars, He taketh also a cypress, and an oak, And he strengtheneth it for himself Among the trees of a forest, He hath planted an ash, and the shower doth nourish it.
content_old: 14 Cutting down to himself cedars, He taketh also a cypress, and an oak, And he strengtheneth it for himself Among the trees of a forest, He hath planted an ash, and the shower doth nourish it.

content: 15 And it hath been for man to burn, And he taketh of them, and becometh warm, Yea, he kindleth it, and hath baked bread, Yea, he maketh a god, and boweth himself, He hath made it a graven image, And he falleth down to it.
content_old: 15 And it hath been for man to burn, And he taketh of them, and becometh warm, Yea, he kindleth it, and hath baked bread, Yea, he maketh a god, and boweth himself, He hath made it a graven image, And he falleth down to it.

content: 16 Half of it he hath burnt in the fire, By this half of it he eateth flesh, He roasteth a roasting, and is satisfied, Yea, he is warm, and saith: ‘Aha, I have become warm, I have enjoyed the light.
content_old: 16 Half of it he hath burnt in the fire, By this half of it he eateth flesh, He roasteth a roasting, and is satisfied, Yea, he is warm, and saith: ‘Aha, I have become warm, I have enjoyed the light.

content: 17 And its remnant for a god he hath made—For his graven image, He falleth down to it, and worshippeth, And prayeth unto it, and he saith, ‘Deliver me, for my god thou art.’
content_old: 17 And its remnant for a god he hath made—For his graven image, He falleth down to it, and worshippeth, And prayeth unto it, and he saith, ‘Deliver me, for my god thou art.’

content: 18 They have not known, nor do they understand, For He hath daubed their eyes from seeing, Their heart from acting wisely.
